Rebecca is 31 years old.  She and her fiancee live at Congo Town in Montserrado County which has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.  Her fiancee is a carpenter and they have 2 children who are 4 and 7 years old.   They attend school and live at home. 

Since 2009, she has sold fish in her community market. Sometimes she has less customers but most of the time she makes a lot of money, She requests a loan to purchase more fish for her business.  In the future, she plans to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business,

loans.name: Cecilia Stephannie

texts.es: Cecilia de 19 años de edad es madre soltera y habita junto a su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad, hermana y madre. Para ella lo más importante es su hijo y es por el que hace todo lo que este en sus manos para darle mejores condiciones de vida. Posee un pequeño negocio donde vende variedad de productos derivados del elote tales como: riguas, tortas de elote, tamales, atol y elotes asados. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos, tiene tres años de trabajar en el mismo y desea mejorar sus ventas para lo cual es necesario invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de insumos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar mayor cantidad de  insumos (elotes, azúcar, sal, aceite, carbón, etc.) para incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos y de esta forma mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 19, is a single mother and lives with her three-year-old son, sister and mother.  What matters most to her is her son so she does all she can to give him the best living conditions.  She has a small business selling a variety of corn products such as corn cakes, tamales, corn drink and roast corn on the cob.  The business, which she has been running for three years, is her main source of income.

She wants to improve her sales and needs to buy more supplies; so she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy more corn, sugar, salt, oil, coal, etc.  This way she can increase sales volume and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy corn, sugar, salt, oil, coal, etc.

loans.name: María Verónica

texts.es: María Verónica cosechó durante el año pasad un total de 7 toneladas, pues gracias a un crédito obtenido por parte de Kiva tuvo dinero suficiente para invertir en su finca. Para esta cosecha ella solicita un crédito nuevamente el cual utilizará para el pago a cortadores de café y para la realización de labores de limpieza en su terreno y prepararlo para resembrar una parte y así aumentar en 2 años su cosecha a 9 toneladas.
texts.en: María Verónica harvested seven tons last year thanks to the Kiva loan that allowed her to have enough money to invest in her coffee plantation.  For the new harvest she is requesting a new loan to pay the coffee workers and to clean the land to prepare it for the planting season.  This will allow her to increase her production to nine tons over a two-year span.

loans.use: To hire coffee workers and clean the land.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia de 62 años de edad reside junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 22 y 15 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de lácteos al por mayor y menudeo. Tiene 7 años de experiencia con el negocio y gracias a los buenos productos que ofrece y al carisma con el que trata a sus clientes ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas que cada día la prefieren más. Desea invertir en su negocio ya que quiere satisfacer una mayor demanda con el fin de mejorar sus ganancias. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: leche y sal para preparar el queso y ponerlo a la venta. Tiene plena seguridad que con los ingresos de su negocio logrará pagar la deuda del crédito.
texts.en:
Lucia, 62, lives with her common-law husband and their two children, ages 22 and 15.  She makes and sells dairy products, both wholesale and retail.  She has been in business for seven years and, thanks to the quality products she sells and the charm with which she attends to the customers, she has been able to gain the trust of many people who prefer dealing with her more and more each day.

Lucia wants to invest in her business so she can meet more demand and improve her earnings.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy the ingredients she needs such as milk and salt to make cheese to sell.  She is sure she can pay back the loan with the income from the business.

loans.use: To buy milk and salt to make cheese.

loans.name: Romelia De Jesús

texts.es: Romelia, con 46 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante sola, ya que nunca recibió apoyo del padre. Desde hace aproximadamente 22 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo ropa, juguetes, utensilios de cocina, entre otros. Esta actividad la inició vendiendo mercancía por encargo, pero luego se le presentó la oportunidad de tener su propio local que le adjudicó la autoridad de espacio público. Allí trabaja de lunes a viernes de 9:00 am a 7:00 y, los fines de semana se dedica a trabajar como empleada en una legumbrería de la plaza de mercado de la ciudad, así logra complementar los ingresos que requiere para solventar los gastos familiares. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, camisetas, entre otros), así podrá tener mayor variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en el mes de diciembre, permitiéndole generar mayor nivel de ganancias, a pesar de los desafíos que se le presentan por la competencia desleal y la falta de compañerismo entre los mismos comerciantes del sector. Romelia manifiesta que quiere seguir luchando por el bienestar de su familia y por su principal sueño que es tener un almacén más grande ubicado en otra zona, donde la competencia desleal no le afecte los ingresos con los que sostiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Romelia, 46, is a single mother of four children who raised on her own without any help from their father.  For around 22 years she has worked as an independent merchant, selling clothing, toys, kitchen utensils, etc.  She started the activity by selling merchanise on an order basis, but then had the opportunity to open her own stand through the public space authority.  She works Monday through Friday, from 9:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  On weekends she works as an employee of a vegetable stand at the city market to earn extra income to cover household expenses.

Romelia is requesting a loan to buy merchandise wholesale (blouses, jeans, t-shirts, etc.) so she can stock more variety to satisfy the greater demand in December.  This will allow her to earn more profit.  Despite the challenges she faces with unloyal competition and a lack of camaraderie between the merchants in this sector, Romelia says she wants to continue struggling for her family's well-being.  Her main goal is to have a larger store in another area where the competition will not affect the income that supports her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise wholesale (blouses, jeans, t-shirts, etc.)

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan de 47 años de edad es soltero y habita en casa propia junto a su abuela, mamá y sobrino quienes a la fecha dependen económicamente de él. Posee una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia y además una venta de panes con pollo los cuales son muy demandados por sus vecinos por ser de calidad y a muy buenos precios. Su deseo es mejorar las ventas de sus negocios ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos y desea satisfacer a una mayor demanda. Por lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de artículos de tienda e insumos para la venta de panes con pollo (golosinas, cereales, bebidas, pollo, panes, etc.).
texts.en:
Juan, 47, is single and lives in his own home with his grandmother, mother and a nephew who he supports economically.  He has a small store in his home and also sells chicken sandwiches which are very popular with the neighbors because of their quality and low prices.

His greatest desire is to improve sales, since this business is his main source of income.  He wants to be able to satisfy the growing demand, so he has decided to request a loan through FUSAI to buy store items and supplies to make the chicken sandwiches (sweets, cereals, drinks, chicken, bread, etc.).

loans.use: To buy sweets, cereals, drinks, chicken, bread, etc.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 29-year-old married lady and the mother of three children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. Samina stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from the Kashf Foundation. Samina intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will allow her to sew more dresses to generate a healthier income. Samina is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Robert Cesaire

texts.fr: Cesaire est un homme de 26 ans, Marié et père d'un enfant âgé d'un ans. Il a ouvert un restaurant qu'il gère depuis quelques temps dans un quartier de la capitale. IL se ravitaille en détail dans des marchés avoisinant. Ceci ne lui permet pas de satisfaire toute sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir de jour en jour. C'est pour cette raison qu'il s'est tourné vers nous pour solliciter un financement. Dernier lui permettra de se réapprovisionner en produits alimentaires ( spaghetti, farine, haricot et autres...) ceci augmentera non seulement ses ventes mais aussi son bénéfice. bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Cesaire is a 26-year-old man who is married and the father of a one-year-old. He owns a restaurant which he has been running for a while in a district of the capital. He gets his supplies at retail prices at the surrounding markets. This does not allow him to satisfy his consistently growing clientèle, which is why he has come to us to request financing. This would allow him to stock up on food products (flour, sugar, beans, etc.) which would not only increase his sales, but also his profit. Part of this profit would be reinvested in the expansion of his business, and the rest would enable him to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, beans and other food products.

loans.name: Gilmard

texts.fr: Gilmard est un jeune homme âgé de 35 ans père de 4 enfants donc l'aine est âgé de 13 ans et le dernier de 3 mois . Il est commerçant et a ouvert une petite alimentation qu'il gère lui même depuis quelques années dans un quartier de la capitale. C'est grâce à elle qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son accueil chaleureux et ses relations de bon voisinage, il a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps, et là, il ne parvient plus à la satisfaire totale d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité en ce moment parce qu'il lui permettra d'augmenter le stock des produits de première nécessité( savons, riz, sucre, allumettes, pétrole et autres... Ceci augmentera se ventes mais aussi ses bénéfices. bénéfices qui seront en partie réinvestis dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Gilmard is a young 35-year-old man who is the father of 4 children, the eldest of whom is 13 years old and the youngest, 3 months. He is a retailer and owns a small store which he has been running for a few years in a district of the capital. It is thanks to his business that he is able to meet his family's needs. Thanks to his warm welcome and the good relationships he has with his neighbours, he has been able to build up a loyal customer base over time. Unfortunately, he is no longer able to completely satisfy his clientèle, which is why he needs this loan for his business right now, as it will enable him to stock up on basic products (soap, rice, sugar, matches, petrol etc.). This will increase his sales and also his profit. Part of this profit will be reinvested in the expansion of his business, and the rest will enable him to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy soap, rice, sugar, matches, petrol etc.

loans.name: Cunegunda Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Monserrate, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de  19 y 5 años, la menor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Monserrate tiene un negocio de asadero de pollos en un local que arrienda en el centro de la ciudad, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 14h00 hasta las 22h00, ella también por las mañanas se dedica a venta de ropa y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella sale a ofrecer sus prendas y productos y también vende  en su local. Tiene más de 19  años con su negocio con el cual ayuda a sacar adelante el hogar.
Este crédito es para comprar pollos, sodas y varios viveres para preparar los alimentos así como también ropa y productos Yanbal. Lleva 11 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le da la institución con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un local propio.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the Tosagua credit group meets every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic. Most of its residents work in agriculture and raising animals, because it is an area with a lot of vegetation.
 

Here lives Monserrate. She is 39 years old, married and has two daughters, aged 19 and 5. The youngest goes to school. Her husband is a taxi driver.
Monserrate has a roasted chicken business in a locale she rents in the center of town. She works there every day from 2 PM until 10 PM. She also sells clothing and Yanbal products in the morning (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She goes out to offer her clothing and products and also sells them from her locale. She has had her business for more than 19 years and it helps her to get her household ahead.  

This loan is to buy chickens, sodas and various groceries to prepare the food, as well as clothing and Yanbal products. She has been in this credit group for 11 years and she likes it because of the help the institution gives with the loans. Her dreams are to own her locale.

loans.use: to buy chickens, sodas, various groceries, clothing and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Josefina Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Josefina, tiene 57 años de edad, hace 17 años murió su esposo pero de esa relación tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. 
A Doña Josefina siempre le gusto ganarse la vida a punta de trabajo y esfuerzo y aun mas después que su marido murió ya que tuvo que afrontar los gastos que genera el hogar y la mantención de sus hijos, ella desde esa época hasta la actualidad se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa lugar en el cual también vende jugos, aguas y gaseosas, así siempre saco adelante a sus hijos y  es su forma de ganarse la vida honradamente.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Lleva 13 años en el Grupo De Crédito,  le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para salir adelante. Sus sueños son segur adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the Tosagua credit group meets every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic and most of its residents work in agriculture and raising animals because it is an area with a lot of vegetation. 

Here lives Josefina. She is 57 years old. Her husband died 17 years ago, but from that relationship she has 5 children who are grown and on their own.  Josefina has always liked earning a living through work and effort, even more so after her husband died and she had to face the household expenses and supporting her children. Since that time until now, she has worked as a merchant. She sells all types of clothing and Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She sells door to door and also from her home, where she also sells juice, water, and soda. This is how she always got her children ahead and it is her way of earning an honest living.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothing. She has been in the credit group for 13 years. she likes it because the loans have really helped her get ahead. Her dreams are to get ahead and have good health.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María de 36 años de edad habita junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 17 años, 14 años y 5 años de edad.  María se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, la venta la realiza en su lugar de residencia y de manera ambulante. De esta forma junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. María es una mujer emprendedora y desea hacer crecer su negocio invirtiendo en la compra de mayor mercadería para satisfacer una mayor demanda y así incrementar sus ingresos con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de ropa para dama tales como: faldas, blusas, vestidos, camisetas, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento ya que este negocio le permite equilibrar los ingresos del hogar.
texts.en: María is 36 years old. She lives with her life's companion and their three children, aged 17, 14 and 5. María sells new clothing. she sells in her residence and as a street vendor. In this way, together with her life's companion, they support the home financially. María is an enterprising woman who wants to grow her business, investing in buying more merchandise to fill a higher demand and thus increase her income. This will improve her and her family's quality of life. She is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying a variety of clothing for women, such as skirts, blouses, dresses, t-shirts, etc. She hopes to be able to have this loan since this business stabilizes her household income.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, dresses, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Yessica Yanira

texts.es:
Yessica, es casada, tiene una hija de 10 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hija, junto a su esposo cubre los gastos familiares, por su parte se dedica a atender su tienda y una granja de aves de corral, es un oficio que aprendió por iniciativa propia, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a hasta las 7:00 p.m., es un negocio que tiene desde hace cinco años, es apoyada por su esposo, una de sus ventajas es que no posee competencia en la zona.
Con la inversión comprará alimentos, vacunas e insumos para la tienda, con lo que tendrá en mejores condiciones la granja y entre los productos que comprara para la tienda están azúcar, arroz, variedad de bebidas, golosinas entre otros, espera surtir el inventario de su negocio para tener mejores ganancias y atraer nuevos clientes.
Aspira a mejorar sus condiciones económicas para cancelar sus deudas, y seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, como  adjetivo tiene darle a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario y educación.
texts.en:
Yessica is married and has a 10-year-old daughter. They all live together. She and her husband work to cover the home expenses. She has a store and raises poultry, something she learned on her own. She works from 6:00 am until 7:00 pm and has had this business for five years. Her husband supports her, and she has the advantage of not having competitors in the area.

With this loan, she will buy food and supplies for her store and vaccines for her animals, which will be beneficial for her farm. For the store, she will buy sugar, rice, different types of beverages and candies, among other things. She hopes to stock her business in order to increase the profits and attract new customers.

She hopes to improve her financial situation and pay back the debts she has, and to continue strengthening her business. Her objective is to improve her family’s living conditions (better nutrition, clothing and education).

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store and vaccines for her poultry business.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 37-year-old married woman who has sold milk for the past 11 years. She has two milking cows. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to enable her to lead a decent life.

Saira has six children, five of whom are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life and a good education along with food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

This is her sixth year with the Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business due to the support of the foundation. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 55,000 to purchase one more cow. Saira hopes to have an increase in the production of milk, which will ultimately help to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Shafqat

texts.en:
Shafqat is a 37-year-old married woman who works from home as a tailor. When Shafqat was not earning an income, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner as her husband was the sole bread winner of the family. 

Shafqat knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her hard work has helped her establish a good clientele but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. For this reason, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and has requested a loan of PKR 20,000. With this loan, Shafqat will be able to purchase a new sewing machine and some spools of thread in various colors. This will enable Shafqat to meet the demands of her customers without fail.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and some spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.fr: Augustin est une homme de 47 ans mariée, père de famille. Il est commerçant et vend des beignets depuis 05 ans dans un quartier de la capitale.Son savoir faire dans ce domaine et les prix pratiqués lui ont permis d'acquerir et fidéliser une clientèle qui s'accroît au jour le jour. Ce qui l'amène à vouloir ce crédit parce que son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle. Grâce à lui,elle pourra augmenter son stock en achetant (des sacs de farine, un bidon d'huile ) .Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie reinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera économisé pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Augustin is a 47-year-old, married man with children.  

He has sold doughnuts in a neighbourhood of the capital city for five years.  His expertise in his trade, and his good prices, have allowed him to build up and retain an ever-growing clientele.  This increasing demand, and his lack of capital, have led Augustin to request this loan.  He will use his loan to buy sacks of flour and a barrel of oil.  The earnings that Augustin makes will be reinvested in his business, and some will be saved to pay for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to increase his stocks of flour, oil and sundry items.

loans.name: Carmen Orlinda Aidee

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo  tres hijos pero dos de ellos fallecieron hace varios años atrás, con ella vive su hija que es madre soltera y vive con su pequeño hijo. Su esposo es jubilado.
Doña Carmen es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder contribuir a los gastos que genera su hogar se dedica a la venta ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días ya que también por las tardes ella prepara y vende corviches, tortillas y empanadas para lo cual instala un pequeño puesto afuera de su casa, a este lugar acuden sus clientes en las tardes y noches que es cuando vende sus alimentos, ella  tiene más  de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual le ayuda a su hija que estudia y para los gastos del pequeño.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the Tosagua group meets every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic. Most of its residents work in agriculture and raising animals because it is an area with a lot of vegetation. 

Here lives Carmen. She is 62 years old, married and had three children, but two of them passed away several years ago. Her daughter lives with her. She is a single mother and lives with her young son. Her husband is retired. Carmen is a housewife who in order to earn her own income and contribute to the household expenses, sells all types of clothes, shoes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She works every day and in the afternoons she makes and sells corviches, tortillas and empanadas. For that she has a small stall outside of her house. Customers go there in the afternoon and evenings when she sells her food. She has been doing this for more than 15 years and with it helps her daughter who goes to school, and for the expenses for the little one. 

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, creams and cosmetics. She has been with the credit group since the start and she likes it because of the help they give in getting ahead. Her dreams are to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy shoes, perfume, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Juaquina

texts.es: Juaquina es una mujer de 44 años, está casada con Pascual de 47 años y tiene 4 hijos que viven con ella en su casa hecha a base de adobe. Hace más de 20 años se dedica a la agricultura en unas parcelas que adquirió con ayuda de su esposo ya que no contaba con otro oficio estable para mantener a su familia. Gracias al apoyo de su esposo ha logrado desempeñar su oficio con mucha dedicación. Posee diversas plantaciones como son el cacao orgánico, árboles frutales; entre otros. Al igual que muchos agricultores de su localidad suele hacer efectivo el uso de abonos orgánicos como guano de aves o similares para lograr obtener en la cosecha una buena calidad de sus productos. Considera que una de las tareas más complicadas es el retiro de maleza viéndose en la obligación de contratar a trabajadores para culminar esta labor en menor tiempo. Considera muy costoso el transporte de sus productos hasta los centros de venta ya que su localidad está ubicada en una parte alta de su región. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente segura de seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Desea en esta oportunidad  contar con  500.00 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en: Juaquina is a 44 year old woman. She is married to Pascual, who is 47 years old. They have 4 children who live in their house made of adobe. She has worked in agriculture for more than 20 years on some land parcels she acquired with her husband's help, since she hasn't had any other stable trade to support her family with. Thanks to her husband's help, she has been able to do her work with a lot of dedication. She has different crops of organic cacao, fruit trees, and more. Like many farmers in her community, she makes effective use of organic fertilizer such as guano and other manure in order to obtain a good quality product. She considers that one of the most difficult tasks is weeding. She has to hire workers to do the job in less time. She considers transport of her product to the sales centers to be very costly because her community is located in a very high altitude part of the region. This is her first Kiva loan and she is confident to keep going ahead. She is also committed to making her payments on time. She wants this opportunity to have the 500.00 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Haydee Del Socorro

texts.es: Haydee del Socorro mayor de edad casada con dos hijos aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora con muchos deseos de salir adelante, es una microempresaria la cual tiene en su casa de habitación un taller de reparación de bicicletas así como también realiza ventas de repuestos , anteriormente tenia una pulperia donde ofrecía productos de granos básicos, pero decidió mejor dedicarse por completo a este negocio, que le generaba mayores ingresos, sus compras las realiza al contado en mayoreos de esta localidad, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos los cuales recupera semanal y quincenal lo invertido, por las tardes ella realiza  deliciosas fritangas como: pollo asado, carne asada, tortitas de carnes, enchiladas, tacos, tajadas, maduro frito con queso, entre otros, el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo en la compra de varios tipos y diferentes repuestos para su negocio. Haydee esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Haydee del Socorro is married and has two children under her care. She is originally from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, located in the west of the country. She is known to be an enterprising woman with a strong will to get ahead. She is a micro entrepreneur and runs a bicycle repair shop at home, where she also sells spare parts. She used to have a grocery store where she sold basic grains, but she decided to focus only on the bicycles business, since it was leaving her better profits.

She pays in cash for her supplies and buys them from local wholesalers. Her customers can choose to pay in cash or on credit. She has a fixed customer base and collects her money weekly or fortnightly. In the evenings, she prepares delicious foods, such as roasted chicken, grilled meat, meat cakes, enchiladas, tacos, chips and fried plantain with cheese.

With this loan she wants to increase her working capital and buy different types of spare parts for her business. Haydee appreciates the help that Kiva investors give people with few economic resources.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy different types of spare parts. Also, to invest in her fast food stall.

loans.name: Love

texts.en:
Love is 25 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with three children between four and nine years old, who attend school and live at home. She has been frying and selling plantains, fish, chicken, and pepper calla for the past five years now. She started this business with money given to her by her father and she learns this business from her friends. Her favorite part about having a business is that it gives her more profit. 

Love is requesting a loan to purchase more plantains, fish, chicken, flour, pepper, oil, etc. for her business. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains, fish, chicken, flour, pepper, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 44 años, está casada con Segundino y vive en su casa hecha de adobe junto a sus dos. Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, ofrece a sus clientes una diversa variedad de productos tales como arroz, azúcar, cereales, enlatados y  otros para la preparación de alimentos. Entre sus principales clientes están sus vecinos y pobladores que acuden a su tienda desde horas de la madrugada ya que posteriormente se dirige a sus terrenos a cuidar de sus sembríos. Acostumbra adquirir su mercadería al por mayor puesto que logra así obtenerlos a precios mucho más bajos. Desea con el tiempo seguir mejorando su negocio para obtener mejores ingresos. Uno de sus principales objetivos es construir su vivienda a base de material noble para posicionar su negocio en las mejores condiciones. Es el primer préstamo que solicita a Kiva y espera contar con el apoyo que necesita para seguir adelante. Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería al por mayor como cereales, arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros esperando surtir su negocio y mantenerlo abastecido.
texts.en: Rosa is 44 years old. She is married to Segundino and lives in a house made of adobe with her two children. Rosa works selling food. She offers her customers diverse products, such as rice, sugar, cereals, canned goods and more for making meals. Among her main customers are her neighbors and townspeople who go to her store from the early morning hours, because after that they go to their land to care for their crops. She usually gets her merchandise wholesale since that way she gets much lower prices. Over time, she wants to keep improving her business to obtain better income. One of her main objectives is to build a home out of brick to keep her business in the best condition. This is the first loan that she has asked for from Kiva and she hopes to get the support she needs to keep going forward. She wants this opportunity to have 1,000 nuevos soles to buy merchandise wholesale such as cereals, rice, sugar, pasta and more, hoping to stock her business and keep it supplied.

loans.use: to buy edible products such as cereals, rice, sugar, pasta and more.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata. She is in her late thirties and from Magburaka, the nothern area in Sierra Leone. She is married. In 2003, Fatmata established her food stand business. She was a housewife and began her business because she wanted to get money and help her husband in running the home. Fatmata works in the business 11 hours per day, 6 days per week. She says that her business is doing well.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more groundnuts, palm oil, rice and cooking season for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family's welfare and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnuts, palm oil, rice and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Haja      Marie

texts.en:
Meet 75-year-old Haja from Magburaka, in the northern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with seven children. 

In 1981, Haja established her firewood business. She began her business because she wanted to create a source of income to support her children and grandchildren. She works at the business 12 hours per day, six days per week. She says that her business is doing well and she is making more profit.

Haja requires a loan to purchase more firewood for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to feed herself instead of depending on her children. In the future, Haja plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood for resale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 56 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines.  

Isabel is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Isabel has been farming vegetables for three years and earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 25 years old and married with three children.

Jennifer works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as cheese curls, bread, dried fish, chocolates, sugar and other groceries.

Jennifer has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Jennifer aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as cheese curls, bread, dried fish, chocolates, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 34 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Daisy is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Daisy has been farming rice for one year and also earns additional income from selling meat.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 36 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Marivic is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed for her pigs.

Marivic has been pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Analyn works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Analyn is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc. for her general store business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Meloysa

texts.en:
Meloysa is 32 years old and married with four children. Meloysa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like coffee, milk, sugar, soap, canned goods, etc.

Meloysa has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load and selling veterinary products.

Meloysa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like coffee, milk, sugar, soap, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Johann

texts.en:
Johann is 25 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Johann is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Johann has been pig fattening for 1 year and also earns additional income from farming rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 28500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Ofelia has been in this business for 32 years. Ofelia earns more income from her general store.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Baironesah

texts.en:
Baironesah is 34 years old, married, and works hard to support her husband. She has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store. 

Baironesah is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell for her business.

Baironesah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Yesica María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Yesica, tiene 46 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 14 y 11 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Yesica es una mujer que le gusta ganar lo suyo para así no depender de su marido sino mas bien ayudarlo a sacar adelante su hogar, ella  tiene un pequeño asadero de pollos en su casa, allí trabaja todas las tardes y noches pero por las mañanas también se dedica a la venta de ropa las mismas que vende puerta a puerta y  también en su local. Tiene más de 5 años con su negocio el cual le deja muy buenas satisfacciones ya que además de ganarse algo también está al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar pollos y ropa de todo tipo. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque  los créditos le permiten mejorar su negocio cada día. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
Tosagua Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua, a place known for being very dynamic where most of the residents work in agriculture and raising animals because there's a lot of vegetation in the area.

Yesica, 46, lives there.  She's in a common-law marriage and has two children, ages 14 and 11, who attend school.  Her husband's a merchant.

Yesica's a woman who likes to earn her own money so she doesn't have to depend on her husband.  Rather, she helps him get the household ahead.

Yesica has a small chicken rotisserie in her house where she works every afternoon and evening.  She also works mornings selling clothing door-to-door as well as in her space.  She has had her business for more than five years and it provides good compensation because she earns something and is always ready for her children's needs.

The loan is to buy chicken and a variety of clothing.

Yesica has been in the credit group for five years and she likes it because the loans let her improve her business every day.  Her dream is to have a big store.

loans.use: to buy chickens and clothing

loans.name: Kafokan. Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   KAFOKAN  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 6enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DIALANIKORO un des villages de KEBILA, qui est  une des Sous-préfecture de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur treizième prêt avec l’institution..
Mme  KORIKA  (1ère à droite sur la photo) compte acheter avec son prêt des écorces de palmier, les confectionne en éventail puis les revendre à au marché et en famille. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 11 500FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kafokan. Group are all married women around 39 years old, and with an average of six children.  They live in polygamous families in Dialanikoro, which is one of the Kebila villages, a sub-prefecture of the third administrative region of Mali.

The women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, to improve their businesses.  This will be their thirteenth loan with the field partner.

Korika (on the far right of the photo) will use her loan to buy palm tree bark, which she will use to make various articles for sale at the market, and within her family.

She expects to earn a monthly average of 11,500 francs CFA, and will use her earnings to repay her loan and help her husband with the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy palm tree bark to make various articles for sale.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana de 45 años de edad habita junto a su compañero de vida en casa alquilada desde hace mucho tiempo. Ana se dedica a la elaboración y venta de productos lácteos y de esta forma se gana la vida y mantiene su hogar junto a su compañero de vida. Últimamente, ha notado un crecimiento en las ventas y como toda mujer emprendedora ha tomado la decisión invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de insumos para la elaboración de los lácteos y así poder cubrir una mayor demanda que le permita incrementar sus ventas. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de leche para preparar el delicioso queso que tanto les gusta a sus clientes.
texts.en: Ana is 45 years old and has been living with her partner in a rented house for  long time.  Ana makes a living preparing and selling dairy products.  Through this work she earns a living and supports her household, alongside her partner.  Lately Ana has noticed an increase in sales and, like any enterprising woman would, she has decided to invest in buying a larger quantity of supplies for making dairy products so that she can cover the increased demand and increase her sales.  To do this, Ana is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy a larger quantity of milk in order to prepare the delicious cheese that her customers so enjoy.

loans.use: to buy milk in bulk.

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.fr: Veuve de 45ans Améyo vit avec son enfant de 10ans scolarisé à Lomé. Pour prendre soin de ce dernier, elle a démarré la vente des produits cosmétiques(mèches et tissages) dans une boutique. Vue que les fêtes de fin d'année s'approchent, elle sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises afin de revendre pour tirer de bénéfice. Elle espère réinjecter les profits supplémentaires dans l'activité et assurer la bonne scolarisation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Améyo is a 45-year-old, widow who lives with her 10-year-old child, who attends school in Lomé.  In order to take care of her child, Améyo started to sell cosmetic products from a shop.  She sells hair extensions and highlights.

Améyo has requested this loan in order to buy merchandise for resale during the end of year festivities.  She hopes to make a profit and will reinvest her earnings in her business and ensure the continued schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions for resale.

loans.name: Sandra Maritza

texts.es:
Sandra, es casada, disfruta el don de ser madre de una pequeña de 3 años, vive junto a su esposo y su hija, para cubrir parte de los gastos familiares ella se dedica a la panadería, pastelería así como también vende piñatas, es un negocio que lo atiende junto a su esposo y un empelado, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 7:00 p.m., lo hacen en un local de su propiedad, a la fecha no ha tenido ninguna dificultad en desempeñar esta actividad.
Con el crédito comprara piñatas y variedad de juguetes, ya que se acercan las fechas en las que las ventas aumentan y de esta manera su inventario ofrecerá a sus clientes mucho más opciones para comprar. Espera aumentar sus ventas, incrementar sus ganancias y cancelar sus deudas.
Sueña con seguir con tener un negocio más grande, tener más rentabilidad y darle a su familia lo necesario para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sandra is married and is enjoying being a mother to her three-year-old daughter.  She lives with her husband and daughter and, in order to cover part of the household expenses, Sandra makes bread and cakes, and also sells piñatas.  She runs the business with her husband and an employee, on premises that the couple owns.  Sandra works form 6am until 7pm and, so far, she has not had in problems in carrying out this work.

With this loan, Sandra will buy piñatas and a variety of toys as the season for high sales is approaching and, with more stock, Sandra can offer her customers more choice.  Sandra hopes to increase her sales and profits, and pay off her debts.

Sandra dreams of having a larger business, the business being more profitable, and of giving her family everything they need in order to prosper.

loans.use: to buy piñatas and a variety of toys.

loans.name: Kasta Teresa

texts.es:
Kasta de 21 años de edad, soltera con un hijo menor de edad. Es originaria de la zona central del país. Se caracteriza por ser responsable, trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos, y pasar tiempo de calidad. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle a su pequeño un futuro mejor.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de Nacatamales desde hace 3 años en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas  10 horas cada fin de semana para la preparación y venta de nacatamales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y compra materia prima para la preparación de los nacatamales como es los cerdos en pie para engorde y utilizar la carne para la venta y preparación del nacatamal. Kasta agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a   personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabaj
texts.en:
Kasta is 21 years old, single, and has a son.  She is originally from the central part of Nicaragua.  Kasta is responsible, hard-working, and wants to do  better than ever before.  In her free time, Kasta likes to be in the company of her children and enjoy some quality time with them.  Unfortunately, Kasta could not study at university and was obliged to work from a young age in order to help with household costs.  Kasta now fights every day in order to give her young son a better future.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Kasta has been working selling "nacatamales" (a savoury pork, dough, and rice dish) for three years.  She works from home for around ten hours every weekend, as she prepares and sells this dish.  This aim for this loan is to invest it in working capital and to buy basic supplies, such as live pigs to fatten up and then to use their meat to prepare and sell nacatamales.  Kasta is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping poor people to have a decent job and for helping poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to buy basic supplies, such as live pigs to fatten up and then to use their meat to prepare and sell nacatamales.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is 37 years old, married, and has three children.  She operates a convenience store, which she started in May 2013.  She sells special Turkish plastic household needs with encouraging prices. Abir is well known in her region with a good reputation and special customer service. 

Abir is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use to increase her business merchandise with special Christmas items and newly released products that will attract customers' attention and increase her business income. She will also add a special front glass display to improve her store and use every section of it to display new items. She hopes to work on developing her business and to open a supermarket and a special plastic items shop in the future, which will improve her family's socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: to purchase ispecial Christmas items and newly released products

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías, opta por más capital para invertir en la compra de abono, semilla, fertilizantes, herbicidas, con lo que podrá tener lo necesario para sembrar el cultivo de maíz, en las próximas fechas.
La inversión anterior le ayudo a comprar ternero para criarlos y aumentar sus ventas, mejorar su economía, con los ingresos extras ha podido cancelar su deuda y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Elias has decided on more capital to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, and herbicide so he can have what he needs to plant his corn crops in the coming dates.

The previous loan helped him to buy land on which to raise them and increase his sales, improve his finances, pay off the debt with the extra income, and improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Jeanylyn

texts.en:
Jeanylyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains for her business to sell.

Jeanylyn has been in this business for 10 years. Jeanylyn earns more income from pig fattening.

Jeanylyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lea works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from direct-selling live fish. 

Lea is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Lea has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish/fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like an ice box, fishing net, and other fishing materials for her business.

Deborah has been in this business for 5 years. Deborah earns more income from food vending.

Deborah has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like an ice box, fishing net, and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 58 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Caridad is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Caridad has been pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from fishing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 39 years old and married with four children. Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of items like canned goods, eggs, noodles, sugar, etc.

Rosalinda has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Rosalinda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of items like caned goods, eggs, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is 43 years old and is in the business of animals’ sales. She buys animals such as calves at low prices, raises up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. She earns enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

Gulshan is requesting a loan from Kashf Foundation for 30,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase another calf.  She hopes to improve her business to bear her household expenses.  With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

Susana requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net. She has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Susana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetable and root crop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Norma is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables and root crops to sell.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and root crops to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and has six children. She is a small scale farmer from central Kenya.  She and her husband practice dairy farming and grow vegetables. They own four dairy cows and produce at least 30 liters of milk, which she sells to earn an income. Joyce also operates a grocery selling mainly from her farm produce. 

Joyce learned about biogases constructed by Visionary Empowerment  Programme from a friend. She approached VEP to learn more about biogas  and made a decision to construct a biodigester so that she will have sufficient gas for cooking and lighting. In addition with the organic bioslurry, she can practice organic agriculture and will save approximately $50 due to reduced cost on fertilzer, kerosine, firewood, and charcoal. Clean gas will also lean to better health without inhaling the smoke. Her monthly expenses of 8,000 KES include farm inputs, charcoal, firewood, kerosene, food, clothing, school fees, and rent for her grocery shop.

loans.use: to facilitate biogas construction

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 52 years old and widowed. She has seven children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been pig fattening for two years, and she earns additional income from rice retailing.

Alicia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase feed and rice bran for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and rice bran for her pigs

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 61 years old and married. She has eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running the general store for five years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Lilia has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more items to sell, like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, and canned goods. Lilia has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF, before this loan. Lilia aspires to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like soap, eggs, and canned goods.

loans.name: Guillermo Abad

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 65 años de edad estado civil unión libre vive con su esposa y sus hijos  en el Cantón  Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Bruniquilde que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Calabi, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agropecuarias.
Guillermo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maíz. Solicita el crédito para la siembra de arroz, maíz y para la compra que es necesaria en la agricultura como la semilla y el abono. Las compras realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con su familia para compartir.
texts.en: Guillermo is 65 years old and is married in a civil union. He lives with her spouse and His purchases will be made in the city of Ventanas. His dream is to improve his living conditions. In his free time, he likes to spend time sharing with his family.

loans.use: to harvest his corn.

loans.name: Gouri

texts.en:
Gouri is a 27-year-old housewife who studied up to class XII (grade 12). Her husband, Bulu, is 28 years old. He is engaged in agricultural work. He is well educated, and studied up to M.A. (Master of Arts). They have no children. They live in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. They have a kachha house (mud and straw made).

The income from Gouri's husband's agribusiness is too low to meet the expenses for their family. As potatoes are profitable crops, Gouri's wants to increase this business.  She wants to take a loan from BJS to purchase more potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes in a huge amount. She dreams of a concrete house for them in future. She also dreams of buying a cycle-van in future with the profit from her business, to carry her harvest to market as well as give it on hire for another means of income.

She will be thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan, which will help her to live a better life with her family.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to expand their existing potato cultivation business.

loans.name: Jelekha

texts.en:
Jelekha,  46 years old, is a housewife. She is illiterate and can only sign her name and is from a remote region, Altagram of Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She and her husband, Samsul, 62 years old, are raising three children.  One of them is getting education and reads in class VII ( grade 7). One is a mason and the third one is engaged in agricultural activities. Her husband received education up to class IV (grade 4). He is engaged in cultivating vegetables in their small plot of land. Jelekha assists her husband in his work. 

Lately, it has become impossible for them to maintain all the necessities of their family with a small income. They try hard to lead a decent life, but are unable to do so due to their poor earnings.  Now their plan is to cultivate potatoes in their land.  She learned about Kiva's Partner BJS and applied for a loan to buy potato seeds and manure.  She hopes that the cultivation will be profitable as there is a great demand for potatoes in local market.

Her goals for the future are to provide enough financial sustenance to her family and to give a good education to her child. She also aspires to grow her business and earn enough profits from it. She is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and manure for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Sahera

texts.en:
Sahera is a housewife of a rural village Kholaigram in the district Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband, Ainul, and four children, The children are students of class VIII (grade 8), class VII (grade 7), class IV (grade 4) and class I (grade 1). 

Sahera’s husband is engaged in agricultural activities. Sahera's husband works very hard for their agribusiness.  Sahera also helps him after managing her household work.  But the income is too low to manage all the household needs of such a large family, especially the educational expenses of their children.

Sahera wants to give financial support to her family. Sahera has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply business in her locality. She will supply milk and dairy products such as curd, paneer, butter, etc. in her locality  She hopes it will be a profitable business as the products have good demand in the present market.  It will help Sahera to generate greater profits, which will help her to meet the educational expenses of her children and to overcome the financial hurdles of her family.

Her dream is to build a concrete house with the profits in future. She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply and dairy products business.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 53-year-old married woman; she has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase another calf. 

She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She has been running a business selling cloths for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. 

Bushra requested a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy stock of different cloths for the winter season.

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en:
Mkhitar is from Dsegh village of the Lori region. He works at local village school and lives with his mother, wife and two little daughters (ages 1 and 2 years old). Mkhitar's father is a migrant worker, and from time to time, assists his family financially.

Mkhitar has been involved in agriculture for 15 years. He keeps livestock, including cows, pigs, piglets and chickens. Near the village where Mkhitar and his family live, they own a plot of agricultural land where Mkhitar cultivates potatoes. The gathered milk and meat is sold at a local open market, and Mkhitar is able to gather income for his family. 

Realizing the importance of agriculture income, Mkhitar needs financial support. The loan that he is now requesting will greatly assist him to purchase forage for feeding the livestock in the winter. Mkhitar took a loan from a local financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock in the winter

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 24-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: 03.03.14 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise, and to sell in future.

Loan is 37 years old, and she is married. She has two children. Loan lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. The main hardship that Loan faces in her business is the lack of capital. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2010, Loan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid four previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Loan is the group leader of the 03.03.14 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which is comprised of five members.

With her business profit, Loan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise, and sell in future.

loans.name: Jeremae

texts.en:
Jeremae is 30 years old and comes from the community of Loon, Bohol. She is married and has two children, ages four and six. For five years now, she has been engaged in selling Avon products, such as perfume, cologne, face powder, body talc, and accessories. This business helps her meet her family's needs, with the income of 6,000 PHP, on average, that she earns. Her income provides school fees and healthy meals for her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy stock, including lotion, perfume, body talc and cologne. In the future, she would like to expand her business and acquire more products from different brands.

loans.use: to buy stock, including lotion, perfume, body talc and cologne

loans.name: 03.03.15 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
The leader of the 03.03.15 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of four members, Mrs. Tươi is a 47-year-old married mother of two grown children and lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has been operating a food stall/restaurant selling meat for more than 10 years. The main business hardship that Tươi faces is a lack of capital.

In 2010, Tươi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Having repaid four previous loans, she is now requesting a new one to purchase meat to resell. With her profit, Tươi hopes that her enterprise will do well, her family will be healthy and happy, and that she will have the opportunity to travel for a vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase meat to resell.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas is a 27-year-old, married man from Loon, Bohol. He has a one-year-old son to look after. 

For a year now, Jonas has been engaged in a sari-sari store business and also selling gasoline. Unfortunately, due to an earthquake, his business location was put in bad shape. His wife works in a pharmacy and he helped by taking care of what he could still do in their business. 

Jonas is asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy more merchandise like snacks, seasoning, toiletries, and gasoline. 

Jonas hopes that he can rebuild his store location and live his life in a better and more abundant way than before the earthquake struck. 

In the future, he would like to improve his business, to make it even bigger in order to earn better.

loans.use: to buy snacks, seasoning, toiletries, and gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology at Misamis University, Ozamiz City. Her parents earn an income from their food vending business. She wanted to decrease the amount that her parents pay for her education. She joined GDMPC, as she heard them promoting their services. She then borrowed a loan from GDMPC to pay her school tuition fees. Her future ambition is to gain a better job.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Evezel Aisley

texts.en: Evezel Aisley is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Accountancy at Stella Maris College, Oroquieta City. Her father earns an income from his transportation services business, while her mother is a domestic helper. Living without her mother is not easy, but she never felt an emptiness, for she had a determination in life. Without hesitation, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC Micro-Finance to cover her school fees and miscellaneous costs. She is hopeful to find a job in the future.

loans.use: to cover school fees and miscellaneous costs

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy is studying for her B.S. in Business Administration at Southern Colleges, Oroquieta City. Her determination to help her family in the future inspires her to pursue her studies. She has again borrowed a loan from GDMPC Micro-Finance to pay her school tuition for the second semester. Her dream is to have a better standard of living with her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition for the second semester

loans.name: Yudid Alexi

texts.es:
Yudid tiene 48 años de edad estado civil soltera, vive con su hija en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Bruniquilde que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Calabi, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agropecuarias.
Yudid se dedica a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el préstamo para  poder comprar los fertilizantes para la siembra y para arrendar terrenos.  Las compras lo realiza en el cantón ventanas. Su sueño es mejorar su cultivo y la producción para tener una mejor calidad de  vida. El desafío  que enfrenta es combatir contra las malezas.  En su tiempo libre la gusta pasar con su familia y ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Yudid is 48 years old, is single and lives with her daughter in the Ventanas canton of the Los Ríos province. She is a member of the Bruniquilde loan group, which is located in the Calabi precinct belonging to the Ventanas canton. She makes a living from agricultural work.

Yudid makes a living by growing corn. She is asking for the loan to be able to buy the fertilizers for planting and for leasing lands. She will make the purchases in the Ventanas canton. Her dream is to improve her crop and the production in order to have a better quality of life. The challenge she faces is combating the undergrowth. 

In her free time she likes to spend time with her family and watch television.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Bo Road Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is 36 years old and is married to a trader. The couple has three children. For many years, Fatmata has been a businesswoman who works selling slippers, flip-flops and clothes. She is the featured leader of her group, “Bo Road,” which is requesting their second loan. The group’s previous SMT/Kiva loan had a great positive impact on the lives and businesses of Bo Road members. They successfully repaid their last loan and are requesting a new loan to further expand their business inventories.

Fatmata will use her portion of the group loan to buy dozens of slippers, flip-flops, and bales of clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy dozens of slippers, flip-flops, and bales of clothing to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a vendor who offers vegetables and fruits to the people in her village. She is 48 years old and married, and she has two children. She aims to have a better way of living and to improve her financial stability.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000. She will use it to buy bananas, potatoes, eggplant and cabbages to sell. She hopes to keep improving her sales capacity, and developing her greengrocery business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, potatoes, eggplant and cabbages to sell

loans.name: Federica

texts.en:
Federica is harmoniously residing in a rural community, together with her husband and children. She's in the hog-raising business, earning a net income of PHP 3,500 for every hog that she sells.

Due to financial constraints, she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 10,000. She will use it to purchase hog feed for her hogs. Her profits will be spent on school fees for her children. She's hoping that her business will become more profitable and improve.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely, 49 years of age, is widowed and has five children. She's been operating a hog-raising business for almost five years and she is earning a net income of PHP 1,500 per hog. Her profits are usually spent on the family's electric bills, school allowances, and basic necessities. 

Due to financial insufficiency, Fely would like to request a loan from those generous lenders, amounting to PHP 10,000, to purchase hog feed and hogs to raise. She's hoping that her requested loan will improve her family's living status.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and hogs to raise.

loans.name: Kim Oan

texts.en:
Kim Oan is a 40-year-old, married woman and a loving mother of three children who still depend on her. She lives with her family in Kampong Cham province, where they operate a farming business and run a general store to make their livelihood. Kim Oan has been doing these businesses for nearly 18 years, and earns approximately 10.00 USD per day.

With the loan she has requested in the sum of 500 USD, Kim Oan will use the money to build a household latrine as the one she has is not hygienic. This way she can ensure healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of her family, and protect the environment. Big thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL).

loans.use: to build a household latrine.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a fish vendor who comes from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of five young children. She has been in the business of selling fish for more than 10 years. This is the source of her income.

Editha is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus augmenting her sales and income.

In the future, Editha hopes to make a success of her business, so that she will be able to save more money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is studying for a BS in Business Administration at Southern Capital College. Her parents serve as barangay (municipal) officials in their community. Julie joined GDMPC and has borrowed a loan to pay her school tuition fees for the second semester. Julie hopes to be able to get a job related to her course of study in the future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition

loans.name: Anna Lyn

texts.en:
Anna Lyn is married, with two children. She helps her husband earn a living with her retail store. She has been selling assorted grocery items and RTW (ready-to-wear), while her husband does farming.
