El tipo de negocio que Sulma tiene es la venta, siembra y cultivo de café por más de 2 años actividad que aprendió gracias a sus padres que por vocación familiar y tradición se dedican a ello mismo que le heredo un pedazo de tierra en el cual trabaja junto a su pareja con mucha motivación y esmero. Como desafío encontrado en sus 2 años como productora de café ella ha encontrado la alza de los precios en el mercado sobre los insumos que son utilizados para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a los mismos ya que la competencia no es problema pues sus clientes son personas con muchas opciones pero al final terminan con el mejor producto siendo el de ella uno de los favoritos por su tamaño, sabor e higiene.   
Sus planes para el futuro poder construir su propia casa de habitación la cual puedan compartir junto a su pareja ya que en la actualidad viven bajo el techo de sus padres. Sus sueños poder asistir y tecnificar muy bien sus cultivos, ampliarlos y cultivar una variedad diferente a la que actualmente tiene para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL financiamiento el cual será utilizado para pagar mano de obra para la recolección del grano así como la limpieza y lavado del mismo como también la limpieza de su propiedad. Ella espera ser apoyada con este financiamiento ya que como mujer joven ella quiere superarse y salir adelante, contribuir en el hogar con su familia y demás para posteriormente hacer realidad sus metas, y sueños.
texts.en:
Sulma is 21 years old and is a housewife and farmer. She has completed her primary education thanks to the financial and moral support of her parents.  She has a partner but up until now she and her partner, who is a security guard, have decided not to have children. 

For 2 years Sulma has had a business planting, growing and selling coffee. She learnt the skills from her parents who, following the family tradition, do the same kind of work. They gave Sulma a piece of land, which she and her partner cultivate with a great deal of enthusiasm and care. During her 2 years as a coffee producer one of the challenges she has faced has been the increase in the market price of the supplies which are used to promote and maintain the crop. Competition is not a problem; her customers have plenty of options but in the end they go for the best product and hers is one of the favourites because of its size, flavour and healthy condition.

In the future Sulma plans to build her own house where she can live with her partner, since they currently live under the same roof as her parents. Her dream is to increase the use of technology and look after her crops well, to extend them and grow a different variety from the one she grows currently to offer to her customers.

Sulma has asked the COMIXMUL cooperative for a loan which will be used to pay for labour for picking the coffee beans and cleaning and washing the crop, as well as clearing weeds from the property. She is hoping for the support of this loan since she is a young woman who wants to improve herself and do well in life, and to contribute to the household with her family and others so that later on she will be able to fulfil her goals and dreams.

loans.use: to pay for labour to pick the coffee beans and clear the property of weeds.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hard-working entrepreneur who earns a living by farming rice and raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Rosalinda successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Rosalinda's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is single. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her parents. 

To help for a living, she runs a business where she prepares peanut butter and she sells it at the town market. She earns so well from this that she had to plan to expand her business. 

Estela borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy raw ingredients in order to gain more customers and profit, as well. 

In the future, she wants to be successful in her business, to have a better source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her peanut butter business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is married, with one child. He runs a service-based business, providing motor transportation in his community. He has been doing this for sixteen years, earning well for the family. 

Alex joined GDMPC and has requested a new loan to buy new tires for his vehicle. Alex always finds ways to improve his family's living conditions. In the future, he wants to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is 45 years old and married, with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Margie has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya. She has been able to improve her business over the years and also improved her family living standards.

She is requesting a loan of ksh 35,000 to purchase sacks of coconuts for her business. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 41 years old and married, with four children.

Marissa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marissa has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and she also earns an income from selling personal products.

Marissa aspires to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a mother of two children, living in the rich highlands of Kericho. She is an established farmer and has practiced farming for 25 years, where she produces milk, eggs, and tea. She enjoys poultry farming the most, but her challenge is disease outbreaks in the poultry. 

Margaret chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer low-interest rates on their loans, their services are very good, and they have an easy repayment mode. This loan will enable Margaret to purchase poultry feed for her poultry and they will produce more eggs for family consumption and for sale. This will increase her income base and, thus, enable her to cater to other farming projects and also improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed.

loans.name: Raheli

texts.en: Raheli is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has operated a coconut selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase 2 sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny, aged 27, is living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district and has two children. 

She and her husband have been farming rice and growing pineapples and beans. Together, they have been in this business for 10 years. Sometimes, her husband earns additional income for the family by working for others for a fee.
 
Vanny is a fifth-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a new loan. She is going to use her loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, 38, lives with her husband and two children in a village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. 

To make a living, she and her husband have been selling grocery items. Sophea has been in business for 12 years.
 
Sophea has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles and completely paid back the loans. Now she is requesting a loan. With this loan, she is going to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Sivan

texts.en:
Sivan, 43, is married and has four children residing in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. 

To support the family, she has been farming rice for 24 years. Sometimes she works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about US $7 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sivan has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She completely paid back the past loan, which has helped her better support her family’s needs. Now she is requesting an education loan to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her daughter in school until her graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a hardworking man who lives at the coastal region of Kenya.

David sells food such as salt, sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour.

He is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase more stock for resale. He joined Yehu to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of food for resale.

loans.name: Agnellah

texts.en:
Agnellah owns a house in Voi, Kenya that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food . 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es: Don Gabino  es originario de la ciudad de Boaco, de 60 años de edad. Casado y padre de tres hijos. Es de oficio agricultor se dedica a la siembra de maíz y trigo. Inicio sus actividades hace muchos años; trabajaba como obrero y con el dinero obtenido iba ahorrando poco a poco. Tiempo después se fue dedicando a la cosecha de maíz y trigo. Actualmente cuenta con casa propia y con una siembra creciente. Su meta próxima es iniciar el corte de trigo y maíz. Solicita el crédito para pagar salario al personal que realiza el corte y empacado de trigo.  Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para realizar el corte de trigo. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
60-year old Sr. Gabino is a native of the town of Boaco. He is married and has three children. He has earned his living growing corn and wheat for many years. He started out as a labourer and gradually saved some of the money he earned. Then some time later he began farming. Now he has his own house and an increasing amount of land.

Gabiano’s next challenge is to harvest the wheat and corn. He is seeking a loan to pay labourers to cut and pack the wheat. He believes that the money will help him greatly to harvest his crop. In the future he hopes to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: pay labourers to cut and pack wheat

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Doña Sara es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco, de 63 años de edad. Madre soltera de tres hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada. Inicio sus actividades hace varios años; con dinero que tenía ahorrado y ha ido creciendo poco a poco en el negocio. su meta próxima es poseer un tramo propio para lograr vender sus productos. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos tales como: lencería, pantalones, camisetas y pacas de ropa usada entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para seguir adelante con su venta de ropa, mejorar su casa y comprar electrodomésticos. Su plan futuro es ahorrar dinero y mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
63-year old Sra. Sara is a native of the town of Boaco. She is the single mother of three grown-up children. Sara runs a business selling new and used clothing, a job she has been doing for several years. She saved money and slowly invested it in the business. Her next goal is to have a place of her own where she can sell her products.

Sara is seeking a loan to buy merchandise such as underwear, pants, shirts, bundles of used clothing etc. She believes that the loan money will help greatly with her wish to expand her business, make improvements to her house, and buy electrical appliances. Her plan for the future is to save money and renovate her house.

loans.use: buy underwear, pants, shirts, bundles of used clothing etc.

loans.name: Golngai Lom Group

texts.en:
Golngai Lom group is formed of eighteen women who reside in a village which is about 40 kms from Imphal town in Manipur which is one of the northeastern states in India. Nengneilhing is one of the group members who runs a variety shop in the village. She is the profiled member for the group and she is pictured with her hand raised.

Nengneilhing generates income for the family by running a variety shop in a village. The village is about 4 and 1/2 kms from the district town and one has to pay rs.20 to the auto rickshaw driver as the fare to reach the village. She sells small sachets of shampoo, detergent powder, detergent bar soap, onions, garlic, potatoes, cereals etc. Essential needs are sold in the shop as villagers cannot travel to the town market for small items like matches and candles. She usually gets the supplies from the town or at the capital market. The generated income is small and insufficient to manage the family expenses and also to stock a large variety of supplies.

With the loan, she will purchase more cereals, first aid kits and drugs for common illnesses like coughs, diarrhea, and fever. The village is located in a remote place from the town which is a hurdle for easy access to everyday activities, for which reason she is inspired to become the most successful supplier for essential goods in the village. She is glad that Kiva will be supporting the group which is a big happiness for them since they usually get the working capital for their businesses from money lenders at high interest. She says “Thank you so much, Kiva, and God bless you all!"

The rest of the group members are engaged in weaving, piggery, poultry, vegetable selling, rice selling, etc.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her variety shop which will also include first aid kits, so as to earn more income to support the family and kids' education.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Hammer & Nails is the nail shop for men. Established in the fall of 2013 by owner Michael, Hammer & Nails is the perfect salon for guys in the Los Angeles area to get the proper hand and foot care in the comfort of the ultimate man cave. 

Michael got the idea to open up Hammer & Nails when he realized that nail shops in the LA area only targeted women. As a result, he set out to create an environment that catered to men’s needs. Michael’s vision of the ultimate man cave led to large plasma TV’s showcasing all sports, kingsize leather chairs, and complimentary beverages, all while getting pampered.

“I knew pursuing Los Angeles’ first nail shop for guys was a huge risk…” Despite the challenges Michael has faced, his concept has caught people’s attention and more importantly their business.

Currently, Michael is asking for a $10,000 loan in order to pursue his dream of having a Hammer & Nail shop in cities all across the country. He plans to do this through franchising. By helping Michael, men across the country will have a place to call home the next time they visit a nail salon.

loans.use: To pay for franchise fees allowing Michael to pursue his dream of having a Hammer & Nail shop in cities all across the country

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 40-year-old married woman. Her financial conditions are very bad. Her son recently started to drive a moto-rickshaw which did not belong to him. He wants to get rid of paying daily fare/rental and desires to drive his own rickshaw. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body to make his own moto-rickshaw. 

He has a personal bike which he will convert into a moto-rickshaw so he can easily generate income for his siblings. A moto-rickshaw's body has a cheap cost but he does not have even a small amount of money. For the motivation of her son, Sajida requested a loan so he can buy the new rickshaw body and start driving.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw body for her son to convert a bike into a moto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 49-years old lady; she is passing her life with her four sons and three daughters.

She is taking a loan for purchasing material for embroidery by hand. In fact, her whole family is involved in this business. All of them are very expert in their professions and make very fine bridal dresses at home.

Due to demand, they are facing a shortage of material and unable to do fine embroidery. Therefore, Razia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can reduce the shortage of embroidery material. Through this amount, she will buy stocks of threads, fancy cloth, precious stones, sequins, and pearls of various colors. Razia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng, 45, is married and residing in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district. She has six children. 

For the last 22 years, she has been farming rice and growing cassava. The current business earns her about USD 21 per day and she can save about USD 15 each day after daily expenses.
 
Heng has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now she is applying for a loan. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizers and seed for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seed for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en:
Jackie is a hard-working woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, in the region of Mukono in Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past four years, Jackie has been working hard to manage her pharmacy shop, where she sells drugs and treats people.

To help expand her business, Jackie has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs, syringes and gloves. This will help Jackie to generate greater profits and increase her business's products and income. Jackie hopes that in the future, she will be able to provide for her family.

Jackie is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more drugs, syringes, and gloves

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a hard-working woman. She is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma, in the region of Mukono in Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is currently in school. For the past seven years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her raw food business, where she sells matooke, Irish potatoes, and beans.

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beans, matooke, and Irish potatoes, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and increase her family's income. Sarah hopes that in the future, she will be able to construct a house out of the profits.

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more beans, matooke, and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором прекрасная женщина с медицинским образованием. Она родилась в 1964 года. Благодаря своим родителям она поступила в Медицинский институт и успешно окончила. Дилором более 24 года работает в местной больнице. Она очень любит свою профессию, однако она получает маленькую зарплату и это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения ее 2 детей. Ее муж работает в заводе, и он тоже получает маленькую зарплату. Дилором и ее муж с трудом справляются с семейными расходами. Дилором должна купить печку и радиатор для утепления дома в зимний период, но не имеет денег. Она также хочет сделать частичный ремонт дома. С такой целью он обратилась за займом. Дилором запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки печки, радиатора и строительных материалов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dilorom is a wonderful woman with a medical education.  She was born in 1964.  Thanks to her parents, she was able to successfully complete a program at the Medical Institute.  For more than 24 years, Dilorom has been working at the local hospital.  She loves her work very much, however, her small salary is not enough to provide for her two children.  Her husband works at a factory, and he too receives only a small income.  Dilorom and her husband are struggling with their household expenses.  

Dilorom needs to buy a stove and a radiator for heating the house during the winter, but she has no money to do so.  She also wants to start some home repairs.  With these goals in mind, she wishes to obtain a loan.  Dilorom is asking for a loan of $1000 USD to buy a stove, a radiator and building materials.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy stove, radiator and building materials to make home repairs

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: После окончания средней школы, Нилуфар поставила себе цель стать известным учителем. С этой целью она поступила в Педагогический Университет Таджикистана. Нилуфар студентка 1 курса факультета Иностранных языков. Она учит английский и немецкие языки. Она очень умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Учиться отлично и активно участвует на всех мероприятиях университета. Родители  Нилуфара простые рабочие и они не в состоянии оплатить за учебу своего ребенка. Нилуфар обратилась в Имон Интернешенл с целью получения займа для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: After finishing high school, Nilufar made a goal for herself, to become a famous teacher.  With this goal in mind, she entered the Tajik State Pedagogical University.  Nilufar is a freshman in the department of Foreign Languages, where she is studying English and German languages.  She is a very smart and a very hard-working young woman.  She is an A-student and she participates in all of the social events at her university.  Nilufar's parents are factory workers and they cannot afford to pay for the education of their child.  Nilufar turned to IMON International for a loan to pay for her tuition costs.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her university education

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Lidia  de 48  años de edad, tiene 03 hijos que dependen de ella, vive con sus hijos y su esposo en casa propia vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 10 años  al negocio de venta de ropa.
Doña Blanca Lidia también vende golosinas su actividad la realiza de forma ambulante, sus clientes son los amigos, vecinos y personas que ella visita en las fincas de camarón, cañera, fincas de melón y sandia, está solicitando el financiamiento para surtir el negocio porque en época navideña ella vende bastante.
Doña Blanca Lidia está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de ropa nueva de hombre y de mujer como blusas, faldas, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, etc. tiene varios pedidos y desea aprovechar la ocasión para así de esa forma tener mejores ganancias. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera también mejorar sus ingresos, su sueño es tener un buen negocio de ropa en su casa y que las ventas se mejoren para este fin de año.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca Lidia is 48 years old and has three dependent children.  She lives in her own home with her children and husband in the community of San Lorenzo, which is in southern Honduras.  Blanca has been in the business of selling clothes for 10 years.  She also sells snack foods as a street vendor.  Her customers are friends, neighbors, and people who visit the shrimp, sugar cane, melon, and watermelon farms.  

Blanca is requesting a loan so that she can restock her business for the Christmas season, a time when her sales are adequate.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy new clothing for men and women such as blouses, skirts, shirts, trousers, dresses, and other items.  She has several orders and wants to take advantage of this occasion so that she can earn more income.  With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her earnings.  

Blanca's dream is to have a successful clothing business in her home and to improve her sales at the end of the year.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2013

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, shirts, trousers, dresses, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es:
Serafina tiene 63 años, es casada con Crisppin de 63 años quien es padre de sus hijos siendo el último aún menor que vive en su casa hecha a base de madera. Es conocida en su localidad como una mujer muy trabajadora.
Se dedica a la agricultura en un terreno de una hectárea que adquirió junto a su esposo hace mas de 13 años donde posee plantaciones de cacao orgánico. Con el objetivo de obtener otra fuente de ingreso paralelo a su actividad agrícola a logrado reunir dinero para cumplir uno de sus principales objetivos  que era la apertura de un pequeño local o tienda dedica  ala venta de abarrotes al por menor ya que en su barrio no existen muchos negocios similares viendo así una buena oportunidad de negocio para ella y su familia.Dentro de las necesidades de su futuro negocio esta primordialmente realizar mejoras en el ambiente de su vivienda destinado para su local como vaciado de piso, colocación de planchas de madera; entre otros. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y desea contar con la confianza necesaria puesto que se siente muy motivada para cumplir sus próximos proyectos personales. Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales como cemento, planchas de madera  y el pago al personal que habilitará al ambiente donde pondrá en funcionamiento su tienda.
texts.en:
Serafina is 63 years old and is married to Crisppin, also 63, who is the father of her children. The youngest is still a minor and he lives with them in their house which is built of wood. Serafina is well known in the area as being very hard working. She works in agriculture on a one hectare plot of land which she and her husband bought more than 13 years ago. She has organic cocoa plants. 

In order to have a parallel source of income to her agricultural work, she has managed to save up money to fulfil one of her principal goals, which was to open a small shop or premises for retailing groceries. In her area there aren't many similar businesses so she sees this as a good business opportunity for her and her family. As part of the requirements for her future business she initially needs to carry out some improvements to the part of her home where she plans to have the shop, such as putting down a concrete floor, putting up wooden planks and other jobs.

This is her first loan with Kiva and she hopes people will have enough confidence in her, as she is highly motivated to achieve her next personal projects. On this occasion she would like a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy materials such as cement and planks of wood and to pay the workers who will fit out the space where she will set up her shop.

loans.use: to buy cement and planks of wood and to pay workers.

loans.name: Gurbangul

texts.en: Gurbangul is a kind woman from South Tajikistan. She is married and the mother of four children. Her husband is a builder. Gurbangul and her husband live together very happily. She has been busy selling children clothes. She loves children and tries to sell high-quality clothes for the children of her region. Gulbangul has own selling place in a local market. Thanks to the good service, she has her regular customers. She is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni to buy children clothes to increase her working capital. Her profits will improve her living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy children clothes to increase her working capital

loans.name: Sandy

texts.en:
Sandy is married and is a responsible father. He always makes sure that he can provide for all the needs of his family. Sandy has had a farming business for five years. He wakes up early in the morning to check his crops so that he can assure that his farming business is doing well. Sandy is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy fertilizer and seed to plant on his farmland.

In the future, Sandy hopes that he could improve the growth of his crops so that he can improve the quality of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his farming business

loans.name: Sabohatkhon

texts.en:
Sabohatkhon is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1974. Sabohatkhon is married and has three children. She is a very careful mother. She has worked for more than 16 years in a local hospital as a cleaning woman. Sabohatkhon makes her work high quality. She is one of the best workers. 

She always wanted to provide her family with good living conditions but she lives poorly as her salary is small. She wants to buy furniture for her household but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni to buy furniture for her household. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn solely provides for her child's living. She has been running a transportation services business for more than three years, and she earns well for their needs. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for her vehicle. 

Recently, she had borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase a new set of tires to improve the services. She always want to improve their living situation in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is a woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with five children, ages 8 to 23. Vivencia has had a business making brick stoves for five years now. This is her main source of income. Her husband works in their farm. She is asking for a loan to buy steel, cement, and sand, which is needed for her stove production. 

In the future, Vivencia hopes of making her business a successful and sustainable source of income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy steel, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Achieng

texts.en:
Achieng is 56 years old and married. Her husband produces some additional income for the family. They have been blessed with three children and she support two orphans. She has rental houses and she has been in business for 15 years. Right now her monthly income is KES 20,000.

She is borrowing KES 100,000 to purchase building materials to complete her rental houses. She plans to pay her children school fees with the anticipated profit from the business.

This is her first loan and her hopes and dreams are to expand and build more rental houses.

loans.use: to buy building materials to complete her rental houses.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and commodities to the people in her area. She lives in Bohol, Philippines. Minda has been in the business for several years now. This is the source of her income. 
Minda is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and cooking seasonings. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock thus attracting more buyers.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Victorio

texts.en:
Victorio is 47 years old and married. He lives in Isabela with his family. He has been a farmer for more than eight years. His business has really grown over the years. Now he seeks a loan amounting to PHP 18,000 to buy  fertilizer, pesticide and seeds to grow on his farmland. He hopes that in the next five years he will be able to buy rental houses that will generate additional income for his business. 

The major challenge he has been facing on the farm is lack of insecticides. So, he hopes to obtain his requested loan amount to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and seeds to grow for his farming business

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a well established farmer living in the highland area of Kericho. He is married and has four children and has been doing farming for the past 24 years. He produces a variety of things at his farm, but especially milk, eggs, tea, and vegetables, which he sells in the local market. In his many years of farming he enjoys dairy farming the most because milk is very vital to the growth of human beings, and this gives him more income. He finds dairy feeds to be a bit more expensive.

Titus chose Juhudi Kilimo to fund him because of their low interest rate and easy repayment mode. This loan will enable him to construct a dairy unit for his dairy cows, which will give them a conducive environment for growth. Through this loan, his family's income will increase and thus improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Gulu

texts.en:
Gulu, 23 years old, is from the village of Akaurta, Bolnisi district. He has a wife and two young children. He’s a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic man who focuses all his efforts on getting ahead. Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Gulu was unable to get a higher education but he studied for a professional career and works as a driver. His monthly income is 300-400 GEL. He has also engaged in agricultural activities with a plot of farmland where he grows potatoes, maize and haricot. These products are used for trading and for his family's personal use.  
On his own initiative, Gulu wants to start his own business, sell a wide range of fruits and vegetables in the intercity. He would go through the streets in his own vehicle and sell products. Gulu is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the support provided. He will be able to buy a greater amount and variety of produce so that his business will be well stocked. He will be able to take care of customers' needs, working and striving to reach his dream for financial stability and to satisfy his family's needs.

loans.use: To start a business trading fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Erica Vanesa

texts.es:
Ella es erica, tiene 19 años, convive con sus padres y los hermanos menores, uno de los hermanos esta esta en grado séptimo y la otra estudia en el instituto campo alto con ella, la hermana estudia auxiliar de salud oral y entra a segundo semestre y ella estudia cosmetologia y estética integral y entra a cursar tercer semestre.
Ella es una joven emprendedora, responsable, con sueño y meta por cumplir, uno de los sueños es poder terminar su técnico para poder salir adelante y tener una estabilidad económica, pero en estos momentos no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para pagar los estudios, ya que son dos personas de la misma familia a los que ay que pagarles, en este momento no cuentan con el dinero suficiente, a ella le gustaría que le colaboraran con el subsidio de kiva para ella poder terminar los estudios y hacer realidad el propio sueño de ser una esteticista profesional.
texts.en:
This is Erica who is 19 years old and lives with her parents and younger siblings. One of her brothers is in the 7th grade and a sister attends the Instituto Campo Alto with her. Erica's sister is studying to be a dental hygienist and is beginning her 2nd semester, while Erica is studying cosmetology, hoping to be a beautician, entering her 3rd semester.

Erica is an enterprising and responsible young woman with dreams and a goal to reach. One of her dreams is to be able to complete her technical training and to be able to get ahead and achieve economic stability. But in these moments, she lacks sufficient resources to pay for her studies, since there are 2 people in the same family with school bills to pay. At present, they lack sufficient money. She would like to have your collaboration in a Kiva subsidy so that Erica can complete her studies and make her dream of becoming a professional beautician a reality.

loans.use: to pay a semester of matriculation fees at beautician school.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Ana, es casada, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo en casa propia, por la necesidad de generar ingresos para apoyar en los gastos familiares, hace cinco años estableció una tienda en su vivienda la cual atiende de todos los días.
Invertirá en la compra de cereales, azúcar, sal, arroz, jabón, golosinas, etc., con lo que su negocio estará surtido y  responderá a las necesidades de sus clientes en estas fechas en las que las ventas aumentan, espera tener una mejor economía, atraer a nuevos clientes, y cancelara responsablemente su crédito.
Sueña con adquirir un vehículo con el cual puede facilitar el traslado de mercadería.
texts.en:
Ana is married and lives with her husband and son in her own house. As she needed to generate an income to help with the household expenses, she set up a shop in her home five years ago and works there every day.

Ana will buy cereals, sugar, salt, rice, soap, sweets etc. so that her business will be well stocked and will meet her customers' needs during this period when her sales increase. She hopes to improve her financial situation, attract new customers and pay off her loan responsibly. 

Ana's dream is to buy a vehicle which would make it easier to transport her goods.

loans.use: to buy cereals, sugar, salt, rice, soap, sweets etc.

loans.name: Debulah

texts.en:
Debulah is a hard-working woman. Debulah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma, in the region of Mukono in Uganda. She is single and has no child. For the past four years, Debulah has been working hard to manage her business selling raw produce, which includes matooke, potatoes, Irish potatoes, and watermelon.

To help expand her business, Debulah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fruits, matooke, potatoes, and Irish potatoes. This will help Debulah to generate greater profits and increase her business products. Debulah hopes that in the future, she will be able to become a landlord of houses.

Debulah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell, including fruits, matooke, potatoes, and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Catalina Concepcion

texts.es:
Catalina de 32 años de edad, madre soltera originaria de la zona central del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables, en su pobreza lucha por salir adelante y brindarle a su pequeño mejores condiciones de vida. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañia de su hijo y le prepara comida típica como es arroz en leche. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de  productos varios como ropa  zapatos bolsos, de segunda mano. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Catalina is 32 years old. She is a single mother and a native of the center of the country. She is hard-working and responsible. In her poverty she struggles to get ahead and give her child better living conditions. In her spare time she enjoys the company of her son and makes him traditional food like Rice pudding. Unfortunately she could not continue her studies due to lack of economic resources.

Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead she has as a business, the sales of various products like second-hand clothes, shoes and bags. She works 8 hours a day selling her products. The object of the loan is to invest in working capital, stocking her business so that in a not too distant future she'll be able to generate graeter income.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business buying second hand clothing shoes and purses.

loans.name: Columba

texts.en: Columba is farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been farming for several years now. This is the source of her income. Columba is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen is running a general store while her husband is working in a private company to make a living. She has been selling groceries for more than 13 years and has earned well from it for the family. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to buy more grocery items for sale. She is hopeful to sustain her business and to be able to have a stable source of income for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for sale

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene runs a cafeteria where she has sold specialty foods and snacks for eight years, earning her living well. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy additional soft drinks and raw ingredients for her specialty foods. She wants to improve her business to gain more profit for better living conditions for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional soft drinks and raw ingredients for specialty foods

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been in the farming business with her husband for more than 10 years, now. Milagros helps her husband in tilling their field.

Milagros is asking for a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and pesticide for the farm. With this, she will be able to grow healthy crops. Thus, the loan will enable her to augment her harvest. In the future, Milagros hopes to make their farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for the farm

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
Cora operates a cafeteria, while her husband is working as a public teacher. She has been doing this for ten years and she earns well from it. 

To improve her business, Cora borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy ingredients and additional utensils to be used in the cafeteria. She always wants to have a better living with her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and additional utensils for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en: Elina is married and the mother of two school-aged children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. She earns a living by running a business where she sells various household utensils such as cups, plates and cutlery as well as clothing and other items. She cites price fluctuations as her biggest single challenge. Elina is requesting a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy household utensils and bales of clothing for her business. She joined Yehu as a way to secure financial support.

loans.use: to buy household utensils and bales of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in the highland area of Kericho, which is mostly known for production of very rich tea. He is married and has five children. He has been doing farming for 15 years, where he produces and sells milk, tea, and eggs. He enjoys farming very much, especially poultry farming.

Daniel chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they give out their loans at a low interest rate and their loans have a grace period on repayment. This loan will enable him enlarge his poultry farm and, thus, sell more eggs which will increase his income. This will enable him better educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is woman who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the past ten years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuations as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop, in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase goods to resell at her kiosk, including salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase goods to resell at her kiosk, including bread, milk, and beans.

loans.name: Geovanny Fredy

texts.es:
Geovanny, a sus 34 años de edad, se ha ganado la vida a pulso, trabajando arduas jornadas en diferentes empleos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. 
Hace 4 años, con el ánimo de generar mejores ingresos, decidió montar su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes ubicado en una avenida principal del sector donde reside, por lo que ha logrado ser reconocido y ha tenido muy buena aceptación por parte de los habitantes.
El cliente manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener su negocio bien acreditado y surtido, para tener mayor rentabilidad; esto lo impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que podrá surtir con mecato, gaseosas, lácteos, café, galletería y otros productos de la canasta familiar que son de primera necesidad, así suplirá las necesidades y gustos de su clientela y podrá mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. Esto le dará la capacidad para mejorar las condiciones de vida y seguir invirtiendo capital en su negocio para que sea más próspero y pueda permanecer en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Geovanny at 34 years old has earned his living steadily, working hard days in a variety of different jobs in order to support his household. Four years ago with the idea of generating more income he decided to open his own business, a grocery store located on the main street of the area where he resides. It has become known and accepted by the local residents.

Geovanny has stated that his main desire is to well-known and well-stocked so he can make more profit. This made him decide to request the help of a loan to buy  pastries, soft drinks, dairy products, coffee, biscuits and other basic food items. This will supply the necessities and tastes of his customers and should increase the income he gets for his labor. It will also allow him to improve his living conditions and continue to invest capital in his business that it becomes more profitable and sustainable over time.

loans.use: to stock his store with pastries, soft drinks, dairy products, coffee, biscuits and other basic food items.

loans.name: Fécilité Line

texts.fr: Line est une femme de 28 ans célibataire et mère  d'un enfant de 3 ans. elle est commerçante et dispose d'un bar dans un quartier de la capitale depuis quelques années. elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. Mais son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire toute sa clientèle qui est parfois obligée de se retourner vers la concurrence. Ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital .elle voudrait avec ce crédit augmenter les casiers de boisson  afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle . cela va également augmenter son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son bénéfice. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et d'agrandir son activité.
texts.en: Line is a 28 year old woman, who is single and has a three year old child. She is in the retail trade and has had a bar in a quarter of the capital for several years. She has much experience in this business. However, her capital is no longer sufficient to allow her to meet her customers' demand and they sometimes have to turn to her rivals. This is due to her limited capital. With this loan she would like to increase her stock of crates of drinks to enable her to satisfy her clientele. It will also increase her revenue and her profits. The income that this generates will enable her to provide better for her family and to expand her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock of crates of drinks.

loans.name: Marie Pascaline

texts.fr: Marie est une femme de 34 ans mariée et mère  de 4 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 3 et 10 ans. elle est commerçante et dispose d'un bar dans un quartier de la capitale depuis quelques années. elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. Mais son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire toute sa clientèle qui est parfois obligée de se retourner vers la concurrence. Ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital .elle voudrait avec ce crédit augmenter les casiers de boissons  afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle . cela va également augmenter son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son bénéfice. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et d'agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Marie is a woman of 34, married and the mother of four children whose age varies from three to 10 years. She is a businesswoman and has owned a bar in a district of the capital for several years. She has the advantage of good experience in this field. However, her capital does not allow her to satisfy all her clientele who are sometimes obliged to turn to her competition. 

Since this is caused by her meager capital, she would like to use this loan to buy more cases of drinks so as to satisfy the demand of her clientele. This will also grow her turnover and her profit. The income generated will permit her to better care for the needs of her family and grow her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cases of drinks

loans.name: Davit

texts.en: Davit is a 38-year-old married man from the small village of Sachkhere district. He lives with his wife, two children and his mother, who is a pensioner. Davit's wife works as a teacher at the local school and earns 330 Gel per month. The family has a cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. They milk the cow every day and produce cheese to sell locally. Davit owns a 1.25-hectare plot of agricultural land where he is going to grow potatoes. The Start Up program, which is  a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of USD $4,000 for purchasing calves and potato seeds. As the calves are purchased, Davit will raise them to resell at higher prices and the harvested potatoes will be sold locally. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family. Davit awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves and potatoes

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 29 years old and a married man from Telavi city. He lives with his little child and his wife who works at a micro-finance organization and gets 900 GEL monthly. Levan is a distributor and has a fixed salary monthly. He is an enthusiastic and motivated person, with great desire to start private activities and ensure his family with every needed thing. 

Levan has a plan to set up a poultry farm, buying 700 hens and distributing eggs. He has also arranged rooms, scoops and infrastructure for the chickens. Levan has experience in this area of work and he will find it easy to organize this distribution. From the requested loan, he also wants to cultivate mushrooms, buying seeds and growing them in a separate room, which he has also arranged with everything needed. Earlier they were growing mushrooms for family use and according to their good productivity, Levan thinks that this business will be succesfull. The loan will be huge support for this hard-working man.

loans.use: To set up a poultry farm and also cultivate mushrooms

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: La  señora Antonia tiene 23 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de desayunos ya sea café, té o mates  desde hace mucho tiempo, vende  en su puesto de venta que se encuentra  ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la localidad de Chulime,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Antonia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus desayunos como: azúcar, café  al por mayor,  la señora Antonia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que por la zona  hay muchas pensiones donde ofrecen variedad de alimentos, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos para preparar sus alimentos,  se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Sra. Antonia is 23 years old.  She has been selling breakfasts, as well as coffee, tea, and "mate" (a warm herbal beverage) for a long time.  Antonio sells from a vending stall located in her home in the town of Chulime.  

This loan is her first transaction with Emprender.  Sra. Antonia will use the loan to buy supplies for preparing breakfasts such as sugar and coffee in bulk.  She faces challenges in her business, such as competition in the area since there are many dining establishments that offer a variety of food.  Antonia will use her profits to continue buying supplies for preparing food.  She is pleased and appreciates the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy sugar and coffee in bulk.

loans.name: Paradiso Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Swezi est une Couturière depuis 2 ans et membre d’un groupe d’Affaires « Paradizo » âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère des enfants qui tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse des médicaments dans une pharmacie de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir pour acheter 4 boites de médicaments( paracetamol, sirot, quinine, penicillin,etc.). Son conjoint est un enseignant dans une école secondaire de la place. Elle avait reçu son premier fonds par le biais de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
Swezi has been a tailor for two years and is a member of the business group 'Paradizo'.  She is forty years old, married and mother to children who all attend school.  She sells medicines in a pharmacy in town.  

Swezi has requested this loan from the field partner, Hekima, in order to grow her business.  This new loan will be used to buy four boxes of medicines (paracetamol, cough syrup, quinine, penicillin, etc).  Swezi's husband is a teacher at a local secondary school and he provided the start up funds for her business.

In the future, Swezi would like to increase her business capital, educate, clothe and feed her children.  She would like to thank Hekima for their support and unguaranteed loans for women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 4 boxes of specialised medicines for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla de la edad de 26 años, es madre de una niña a quien apoya para sus estudios, Karla es egresada de la  carrera de derecho penal, pero ella está necesitando ingresar al curso de titulación para poder ejercer como abogada, pues en la actualidad labora como asistente legal en una oficina jurídica, con el título en mano podrá mejorar sus condiciones económicas y crecer en conocimientos adquiriendo experiencia, es por eso que Karla solicita el apoyo de crédito para lograr hacer realidad este sueño.
texts.en:
Karla is 26 years old and has a daughter whom she is supporting with her education. Karla has graduated from a course in criminal law, but she needs to do the degree course in order to practise as a lawyer. At present she is working as a legal assistant in a law firm but once she has the qualification she will be able to improve her financial situation and increase her knowledge by gaining experience. 

This is the reason why Karla is asking for the support of the loan so she can make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to pay for a degree course.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina Mayor de edad madre soltera con seis hijos de los cuales solo uno esta bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer  trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo culminar sus estudios terminando solo la primaria por lo que se vio en la necesidad de trabajar a desde muy joven para ayudar con los gastos del hogar en su familia, actualmente ella lucha día a día para brindarle un mejor futuro a su hijo que aun esta bajo su responsabilidad, Luz Marina tiene un taller de tortillas en su casa de habitación así como también vende leña, frijoles cosidos, cuajadas, cremas, queso entre otros, negocio que tiene desde hace seis años, su jornada diaria empieza desde muy temprano comenzando a  preparar el maíz par nixquezar y luego moler y elaborar las tortillas.El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de materia prima para elaborar las tortillas como: maíz, leña, cal, gas, fósforo, bolsas plásticas, comales.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a single mother with six children, only one of whom is currently dependent on her. She comes from a town in Chinandega in the west of the country. She describes herself as being a hardworking and responsible woman with a desire to improve herself. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, she couldn't finish her studies, and only completed primary school. For that reason she has had to work very hard since she was very young to help out with the household expenses. She now fights every day to give the son she still looks after a better future. She produces tortillas at her home as well as selling firewood, cooked beans, junket, cream and cheese, among other products. She has had this business for six years.

Luz Marina's day starts very early when she starts preparing the corn for making dough, and then grinds it and makes the tortillas. She plans to invest the loan in her business by buying the basic materials she needs for making tortillas, such as corn, firewood, lime, gas, matches, plastic bags and hotplates.

loans.use: to buy basic materials like corn, lime, gas, matches, firewood and other items.

loans.name: Ana Mirna

texts.es:
Ana, se ha decidido por invertir nuevamente capital en su negocio, con lo que comprara maíz, leña, gas propano, bolsas, papel y dos puertas con sus balcones, al realizar esta compra tendrá los insumos necesarios para fortalecer su negocio y podrá mejorar la estructura de su vivienda.
Con el préstamo anterior ella pudo equipar el negocio de venta de venta de tortillas y mariscos, genero mejores ingresos, tiene más clientela, cancelo sus deudas y sus ventas han aumentado. Ha mejorado mucho la alimentación que ofrece  a su familia, hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Ana has decided to invest additional capital into her business.  She will use the money to buy corn, firewood, propane gas, bags, paper, and two doors with security bars.  This will enable her to have the necessary supplies for strengthening her business and also to improve the structure of her home.  

Her previous loan enabled her to equip her business of selling tortillas and shrimp.  As a result, she generated more income, gained more customers, repaid her debts, and increase her sales.  Ana has been able to provide more food for her family.  To date, she has not had any problems with continuing her work.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, propane gas, bags, paper, and two doors with security bars.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Teresa, es madre soltera de una niña, vive en una casa familiar, por la necesidad de tener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos y los de su hija hace 6 años que se dedica a vender frutas en su casa y en la escuela de su localidad, lo hace un horario de 7:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m. 
Comprará melones, sandía, naranjas, piñas, con lo que podrá trabajar por un tiempo y fortalecerá su negocio, espera aumentar sus ventas, ofrecer productos de calidad, tener mayores ganancias y poder cancelar sus cuotas.
Seña con tener un negocio estable y rentable, para comprar un vehículo que le facilite el traslado de sus productos y seguir aportando en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Teresa is a single mother who lives with her daughter in their own house. Six years ago, since she needed to find a way to make ends meet and cover household expenses, Teresa launched a business selling fruit from her home. She works from 7:00 every morning until 2:00 every afternoon.

With the support from this loan, Teresa plans to purchase fruit to stock her business, including watermelons, oranges, melons, pineapple and other items. She hopes this investment will help her to strengthen her business and increase overall product variety, sales and profits. In time, as her business becomes more stable and profitable, Teresa would like to purchase a car to transport her products to market, as well as continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase melons, watermelons, oranges, pineapples and other fruits to stock her business.

loans.name: Iris Lorena

texts.es:
Iris, se decidió por otro crédito para fortalecer la tienda comprara bebidas, elotes,  carnes, golosinas, aceite, etc., con lo que tendrá los productos necesarios para su tienda y elaborar los tamales para cumplir con las necesidades de sus clientes y seguir trabajando para mejorar su economía.
Con el préstamo anterior pudo comprar los ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales, con los que aumento sus ventas, sus ingresos son mejores y le han permitido instalar una tienda en su casa de habitación, para tener otros ingresos con los cuales cancelar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Iris has decided to apply for another loan to improve her shop. She plans to buy drinks, sweetcorn, meat, sweets and oil which means she will have the products she needs for her shop and for making tamales, so she can meet her customers' requirements and continue working to improve her financial situation.

With the previous loan she was able to buy ingredients for making tamales, which increased her sales. Her income has improved and this has enabled her to open up a shop in her house so she has additional income to pay off her loan instalments.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sweetcorn, meat, sweets and oil.

loans.name: Silvia Dinora

texts.es:
Silvia, se decidió por otro crédito para comprar cal, maíz, azúcar, bebidas, golosinas, etc., con lo que tendrá lo necesario para su venta de tortillas y su tienda, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando.
Con el préstamo anterior compro insumos necesarios para que el negocio estuviera activo, sus ganancias amentaron ha cancelado otras deudas con personas particulares, y pudo cancelar las cuotas del préstamo. Su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Silvia has decided to request another loan to buy lime, corn, sugar, drinks, sweets, etc. Then she will have what she needs for her tortilla sales and for her store, which will permit her to continue working. With the previous loan she bought the supplies necessary to keep her business running, her profits increased and she paid off some loans with people and paid the installments on her Kiva loan. Her family has a better quality of living.
.

loans.use: to buy lime, corn, sugar, drinks, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Marta Gloria

texts.es:
Marta, se dispone nuevamente a solicitar un crédito debido a que necesita capital para invertir en la compra de semilla de marañón, para continuar fortaleciendo el negocio y cumpliendo con los pedidos de su negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior la materia prima de su negocio, sus ventas aumentaron, su economía ha mejorado y le ha permitido cancelar las deudas, así como también dar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Marta is once again asking for a loan as she needs capital to buy cashew seeds, so she can continue to build up the business and fulfil her business orders. 

With the previous loan, sales of the primary product of her business increased, her finances have improved and she has been able to pay off her loan and give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cashew seeds.

loans.name: Gulsaira

texts.ru: Гулсайре 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 сыновей. У Гулсайра - среднее образование, как человек она очень ответственная, пунктуальная и предприимчивая, умеет вести хозяйство, вкладывает деньги в нужное русло. Соседи характеризуют ее как примерного человека, и заботливую мать. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулсайра занимается животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулсайры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 нетели и 35 овец. В доме у Гулсайры имеются все необходимые условия для содержания и разведения скота. Гулсайра трепетно и с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу, ежегодно увеличивает поголовье скота. В хозяйстве ей помогает муж. У Гулсайры есть приличный опыт в животноводстве. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулсайра обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом- на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулсайра планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины.
texts.en:
Gulsaira is 52 years old, married and, with her husband, is raising two sons.  Gulsaira has a high school education.  She is a responsible and a punctual person, who has the experience in running the household and in investing her money into the right channels.  Her neighbors characterize her as an exemplary person and a great mother.  The main income to Gulsaira's family comes from raising livestock, a business that she started 12 years ago with a purchase of cattle for 20,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, she now has two milking cows, two heifers and 35 sheep.  Gulsaira's household has all of the necessities required for raising cattle.  

Gulsaira applies a lot of skill and patients to keep expanding her herd year to year.  Her husband helps her with raising of livestock.  Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further her business, Gulsaira turned to the Microfinance bank of Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan to purchase additional sheep.  Profits from her business she is planning to reinvest into further expanding her herd and to save some for the purchase of a car.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is a hard-working woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma, in the region of Mokono, in Uganda. She is single and has no children currently in school. For the past five years, Milly has been working hard to manage her hardware shop, which deals in metals, glass, and cement. 

To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of UGX 800,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her hardware items and will help Milly to generate greater profits and expand the size of the business. Milly hopes that, in the future, she will be able to own a big retail hardware shop. 

Milly is a member of BRAC Uganda's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to increase her hardware items for sale.

loans.name: Ruben Armando

texts.es:
Rubén, es soltero, no tiene hijos, para cubrir sus gastos personales se decida a atender su taller de bicicletas, en un horario de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m., su ventaja es que reside en una zona donde no tiene competencia.
Invertirá en la mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, para dar una imagen más presentable ante sus clientes, esperará brindar un mejor servicio, atraer a nuevos clientes, aumentar sus ingresos y cancelar su deuda para luego invertir en otros materiales.
Sueña con tener un negocio mucho más estable y rentable para seguir dando un buen servicio
texts.en: Rubén is single and has no children. To pay for his personal expenses he decided to work in his bike shop. He works from 8 am until 5 pm and enjoys the advantage of having no competition in the  area where he lives. He will invest the loan in improving the infrastructure of his business to make it more presentable to his clients. He hopes to offer a better service, attract new clients, increase his revenues and pay off his debt in order to invest in other materials. He dreams of having a much more stable and profitable business so he can continue to provide good service.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of his business.

loans.name: Orbelina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Orbelina, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos de 20 y 16 años de edad, actualmente vive junto a su familia, para cubrir sus gastos y los de sus hijos hace ocho años fundó una tienda, la cual atiende de de todos los días, hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema en atenderla.
Invertirá en la compra de golosinas bebidas y productos de la canasta básica tales como azúcar, arroz y frijoles, con lo que tendrá variedad de productos que ofrecerá a sus clientes, espera tener mejores ventas, cumplir con las expectativas de sus clientes, aumentar sus ganancias y así cancelar la deuda adquirida.
Sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y así tener los recursos necesarios para dar a sus hijos un estilo de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Orbelina is a single mother who has two children aged 16 and 29 who still live with her. To cover the expenses of her children she founded a store eight years ago. She works every day and up to now she has had no problems running it.

Orbelina will invest the loan buying sweets, drinks and basic food items like sugar, rice and beans. which will give her a variety of products to offer her clients. She hopes to have increased sales, meet the demand of her customers increase her profits and thereby pay off the acquired debt. She dreams of expanding her business and having the resources necessary to give her children a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy sweets, drinks and basic food items.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 50-year-old, Lebanese, married man. He lives with his wife and only child, who is still receiving necessary education. Hussein works very hard, in cooperation with his wife, to be able to earn enough income to live in good conditions. As for Hussein’s work, he has been involved in the construction field since 1978, specializing in completing wall decoration work. He is well-talented at his occupation. He has built a good business reputation, since his end results are always satisfying and fulfill his customer’s demands.

With the loan he has requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., Hussein will purchase wood and construction tools that he needs. He states that these purchases will help him to improve his services amazingly, and will let him satisfy his customers' demands even more.

loans.use: to purchase wood and construction tools that he needs

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 36-year-old single  woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She earns a living by selling polvoron (a semi-sweet concoction made of toasted flour, powdered milk, sugar, and butter) and puto cheese (variation of a steam rice cake). Her business started six years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients and materials to repair her house.This will help Sonia improve her income as well as renovate her house. 

In the future, Sonia hopes to expand her business to open an internet cafe for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and materials to repair her house

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Aged 33-years-old, Pov is a married mother of three children living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To make a living, her husband has been working as a motor-taxi driver and sometimes she works for others for a fee. To add up more income, she also has a horse cart for rent when someone needs to transport luggage or heavy equipment. The current business earns her about 16,000 KHR per day. 

This is Pov's fourth loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Pov is going to use her portion to buy a horse to support her business. She hopes to buy a healthy horse so as she can earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a horse to support her business

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a hard working woman. Sylvia is 19 years old, and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the region of Mukono in Uganda. She is single and has no children. 

For the past three years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her raw food business, which deals in cassava, matooke (cooking bananas), and potatoes. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more  cassava, matooke, and potatoes, and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and generate income. 

Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to start supplying schools. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more cassava, matooke, and potatoes

loans.name: Young Generation Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Young Generation B” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, in western Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Ramatu.  Ramatu is thirty-six. She was born in one of the several villages that make up Sanda. However, she is currently residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a trader and one of her children is attending primary school and the others are not of school going age. For five years now,  Ramatu has been selling sugar, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. With this loan she will buy sugar, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a hardworking woman who is striving to meet the basic needs of her family.

The previous loan helped her buy food consumables to sell.

Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 40,000 to buy soaps, maize flour, cooking oil, rice, and sugar to sell.

She appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu.

loans.use: to buy soaps, maize flour, cooking oil, rice, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Nzuva est une brave commerçante d’une expérience de plus de 25 ans et membre et conseillère d’une Association d’Affaires « Faida » âgée de 65ans, veuve et mère de 8 enfants qui 7 sont mariés et 1 qui étudie. Elle est vendeuse des fruits tout au long de la route. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 2 paniers d’oranges,1panier des  citrons, 2 régimes de plantains, 1 panier d’avocats,1 panier des mangues, etc. Au début, elle avait reçu de fonds de son ancien mari. Elle souhaite améliorer ses activités, vêtir nourrir, scolariser son dernier enfant et ses  petits fils. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur donnant de  microcrédit sans garantie matérielle et qui sont exclues du system bancaire classique, pendant, ce moment pénible de conflits dans la région de l’Est du Pays
texts.en:
The client Nzuva is a good merchant with over 25 years of experience and a member and adviser of the business association Faida. Nzuva is 65 years old, a widow and mother of eight children - seven of whom are married and one is a student. She sells fruit alongside the road. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She is going to buy 2 baskets of oranges, 1 basket of lemons, 2 bunches of plantains, 1 basket of avocados, 1 basket of mangoes, etc. At the beginning, she had received funds from her former husband. 

She wishes to improve her business and feed, clothe, and educate her last child and grandson. She thanks Hekima for its support of women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system, by giving them microcredit without guaranteed collateral during this difficult time of conflict in the eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to buy 2 baskets of oranges, 1 basket of lemons, 2 bunches of plantains, 1 basket of avocados, 1 basket of mangoes, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Denia Carolina

texts.es:
La joven Denia  de  29  años de edad, vive con su esposo,  tiene 02 hijos que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo  al sur  de Honduras, tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace  05 años al negocio de venta de papel boom, laminados,  frescos,  útiles escolares, fotocopias y comida.
Denia es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para emprender otra actividad generadora de ingresos.
