Denia está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de manzanas, peras, uvas, laminas para carnet, etc. con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar sus  ingresos ya que en esta época de navidad se vende mucho  estos tipos de productos, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma, es su segundo préstamo que solicita.
Denia su sueño es terminar de pagar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Denia  is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children who are dependent on her. They live in San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras in their own house. For the past 5 years she has worked in her business selling construction paper, plastic laminate, stationary products, school supplies, photocopies and food. 

Denia is an enterprising woman with a lot of desire to get her family ahead. She is asking for a new loan to start another activity to generate income. She is asking for a loan to buy apples, pears, grapes, plastic laminate, etc. With the aid of the loan she hopes to increase her revenues as in the Christmas season these products sell a lot. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma. This is her second loan. She dreams of finishing the payment for her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2013.

loans.use: to buy apples, pears, grapes,plastic laminate sheets, etc for her business.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn, 49 years of age, is married to a bus driver and has been blessed with four children. She has owned and managed a restaurant in their village for almost three years. She sells cooked foods daily, for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. In this business she's earning a net income of PHP 2,000 a day. She usually spends her income on school fees for her nephew and on paying electric and water bills.

Due to a lack of capital in her business, she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 35,000. She will use the loan to purchase food ingredients, including raw meat and fish, for her restaurant. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, including raw meat and fish, for her restaurant.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a married woman and a mother of five children from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in a farming business, together with her husband, for more than 33 years now. This is the source of their income. As of this time, Virginia needs additional capital for her farm. She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. Through this, she will be able to improve her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver lives in the rich natural highlands of Kericho with his wife and four children.  He is a farmer and has practiced farming for 20 years where he produces and sells milk and eggs.  He loves dairy farming the most as it brings in more income to him and in Kericho, dairy cows produce very well, but his major challenge is lack of market for the milk.

Oliver chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they have the interest of small scale farmers at heart and they introduced asset finances to farmers and it has helped them economically.  You tend to gain a lot as a farmer especially when you repay the loan before the period due. Through this loan, production will increase and hence his income will increase. This will improve their standards of living.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a merchant woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She is married with 2 children aged 24 and 16 respectively . Her husband works as a driver to support their family. Mercy runs a variety store and sells various items such as biscuits, noodles, soap, cooking oil, eggs and e-loads to customers in the community. Her business started more than 5 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy groceries, canned goods and soft drinks in order to fill her store with stock that caters to the needs of her customers. In the future, Mercy  hopes to expand her business and increase its profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy groceries, canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Yourb

texts.en: Yourb is a villager from the Srey Snom district in Siem Reap province. Yourb is 30-years-old and married with four children. To support the family, she and her husband plant rice and sell grocery items. She has been doing this for 10 years and she can earn around ten dollars. She is a past client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) who helped her family to live better. Now, she is seeking for the third cycle,  3,500,000 KHR.  She will use her entire loan to buy grocery items for resale. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sale

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 60-year-old woman from the town of Cortes, Bohol. She is married with three grown children. Her husband worked as a farmer to support their family. She engages in a food vending business. She sells snack foods like hot cakes, fried peanuts, cassava cakes and drinks to a nearby school to help augment the income of their household.  Her business started more than 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy more supplies like flour, cooking oil, milk and sugar, to produce more and augment her income.

 In the future, Susana hopes to expand her food vending business and increase business profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like flour, cooking oil, milk and sugar

loans.name: Nairuhi

texts.en:
Nairuhi is an experienced farmer from Armash village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband, son, and elderly pensioner mother-in-law. 

She and her son are employed in the private sector. Their salaries, however, are so low that it is impossible to afford a living based on those salaries alone. 

With the help of her husband, Nairuhi is engaged in aviculture, viniculture, and in cultivation of cherries and apples. Her husband and son sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of family's income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Nairuhi needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase materials used in viniculture (cables, pipes), to prepare the vineyard for the cold season, and to renovate the barn, which is currently in poor condition. The loan will help the family run their agribusiness in a more productive and efficient way. 

Nairuhi has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to the hard work during recent times, she was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Nairuhi and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase materials used in viniculture (cables, pipes), to prepare the vineyard for the cold season, and to renovate the barn

loans.name: Florencia Aimee

texts.es:
Florencia, vive junto a su hijo, para cubrir los gastos familiares se dedica a la sastrería, es un oficio que aprendió de su familia y se ha tomado cursos para especializarse en el área, ya tiene 20 años de experiencia y no ha enfrentado ningún problema en realizar este trabajo.
Con el capital comprará telas, zippers, botones, hilos, y otros accesorios, que necesita para esta temporada en la que sus servicios tienen una mayor demanda. Espera poder dar un buen servicio, aumentar sus ventas, y mejorar sus ingresos.
Su sueño es adquirir un vehículo para mejor las condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
Florencia lives with her son and operates her own sewing workshop. She decided to start a sewing business to make ends meet and support her son. Florencia learned the sewing trade from her family and specialized sewing courses. She has 20 years of experience, and the art of sewing has always come naturally to her.

With the support from this loan, Florencia plans to purchase fabric, zippers, buttons, thread and other materials for sewing her handmade products. She hopes to capitalize on the busy holiday season and fulfill many client orders. With this investment, Florencia hopes to strengthen her business and increase sales and profits. Her dream is to eventually purchase a car to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, zippers, buttons, thread and other materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Maria Lucina

texts.es:
María, tiene la edad de 48 años, es acompañada, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 19 años de edad, por la necesidad de aportar en los gastos de su hogar hace 16 años estableció su negocio que consiste en la venta de ropa, trabaja a tiempo completo.
Comprará variedad de ropa, como: blusas, camisas, pantalones, trajes para niños y niñas, entre otros, le servirá para surtir su negocio y estar preparada para esta temporada en las que las ventas aumentan, espera tener mejores ganancias, con las que cancelara deudas y cubrirá los gastos de su hogar.
Sueña con tener un local donde atender mejor a sus clientes y tener más mercadería.
texts.en:
María, who is 48 years old, has a partner and two children aged 10 and 19. Because of the need to contribute to the household expenses she set up her business 16 years ago selling clothing. She works full-time.

María will buy a variety of clothing such as blouses, shirts, trousers, clothes for boys and girls and other items. This will enable her to stock her business and be prepared for this season when her sales increase. She hopes to make better profits, which she will use to pay off her debts and cover the household expenses. 

She dreams of having a shop where she can serve her customers better and have more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing such as blouses, shirts, trousers and clothes for boys and girls.

loans.name: Maliati

texts.en:
Maliati is a hard-working woman; she is 18 years old, and lives in the town of Bugiri in the region of Iganga in Uganda. She is single, and has no children. For the past two years, Maliati has been working hard to manage her clothing business, selling jackets and skirts. 

To help expand her business, Maliati has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Maliati generate greater profits and pay the house rent for her and the parents. 

Maliati hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up a retail shop. 

Maliati is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more clothes

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a hardworking 21-year-old single woman who lives in the town of Bugiri, in the region of Iganga in Uganda. For the past  year, she has been working hard to manage her drug store. 

To help expand her business and increase her profits, Fatuma has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more drugs. She hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger shop. 

Fatuma is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: purchase more drugs

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida, 21, is a hard working woman who lives in the town of Bugiri in the  region of Iganga in Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past year, Shida has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells ladies' and men's clothes. 

To help expand her business, Shida has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Shida to generate greater profits and educate her child. Shida hopes that in the future she will be able to start a boutique. 

Shida is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Appolinaire

texts.en:
Appolinaire is 35 years old, married and has two children, ages 12 and 15. They both go to school. He has been a rice farmer for the past 15 years. He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer to increase rice production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to pay his children’s school fees. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labor costs and to buy more fertilizer for use during rice production.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 18, is a hard-working woman who lives in the town of Bugiri in the  region of Iganga in Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past year, Fatuma has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells ladies' and men's clothes. 

To help expand her business, Fatuma has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Fatuma to generate greater profits and continue her education. Fatuma hopes that in the future she will be able to start a retail shop. 

Fatuma is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en:
Penninah, a hardworking 18-year-old woman living in the town of Bugiri, Uganda, is single and has one child. For the past year, Penninah has been working hard to manage her business, which sells children's and adults' clothes. 

To help expand her business and generate greater profits, Penninah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more clothing for resale. The profits will help her to pay her child's school fees. Penninah hopes that in the future she will be able to start up another business. 

Penninah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a hardworking woman who is 17 years old and lives in the town of Iganga 1 in the region of Iganga in Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past year, Prossy has been working hard to manage her clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for sale, and will help Prossy to generate greater profits and pay her rent. Prossy hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Prossy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a hardworking woman who is 20 years old and lives in the town of Iganga 1 in the region of Iganga in Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Betty has been working hard to manage her children's clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and pay her parents' rent. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to go for further studies. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a hardworking woman who is 17 years old and lives in the town of Iganga 1 in the region of Iganga in Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Esther has been working hard to manage her clothing business, where she sells shirts, skirts, and tops. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothing for the business, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and provide the basic requirements for her parents. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to go for further studies. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for her business.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: cette promotrice habite à quelques kilomètres du guichet. Son activité principale consiste à élever des poussins et les revendre plu tard. Elle pratique de l'aviculture cause pour la quelle elle sollicite ce montant, elle a une expérience de plus 5ans dans cette activité. Avec ce financement, elle va augmenter sa production pour satisfaire ses commandes surtout pendant les fêtes. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A l'avenir elle voudrait avec l'aide de l'institution diversifier son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This borrower lives just a few kilometers from the local U-IMCEC branch. Her main activity is poultry farming, and the reason for seeking this loan. She has been in the business of raising and selling chicks for over 5 years. 

She will use this credit to bolster her production in order to meet customer demand, especially during the holiday period. 

She helps her husband with the day-to-day expenses of the household and the children’s tuition. 

In the long term, with the help of the MFI, she would like to diversify her activity and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chicks that she will raise and sell.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
Ligia 
Grecia 


Ligia tiene 43 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Grecia, en el Valle Central  con 2 hijos y su esposo, además cuida a una nieta.  Mujer emprendedora, trabajo en Norte América para apoyar el estudio de su hija que ahora es una profesional en leyes. Adquiere capital con el que construye su taller, ya que siempre se ha dedicado a la costura. Se asocia con una señora a quien el confecciona ropa deportiva que ya distribuye en varios gimnasios en la zona  y además trae mercadería de Estados Unidos que comercializa en la zona y en lugares aledaños. Independiente y trabajadora.

 Con ahorro  adquirió maquinaria y mejoró las condiciones de su taller. Solicita este préstamo para comprar ropa de hombre, mujer y niño para la temporada de fin y principio de año, y retomar la confección de ropa deportiva a partir del mes de Enero del 2014 obteniendo materias primas de mayor calidad. La actividad cuenta con un patrimonio importante, maneja 2 negocios que le generan ingresos fijos, desea cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes en esta temporada.

Ella se levanta temprano a organizar su casa, a media mañana se dedica a cortar las telas para elaborar las prendas en la tarde y durante la noche se dedica a cobrar y vender la ropa. Desea darle el estudio a su hijo para que se convierta en profesional.

 Cuenta con maquinaria y equipo para su trabajo, clientela donde coloca su producto. Tiene amplia experiencia en la costura y además los contactos en Estados Unidos le permiten tener el negocio de venta de ropa donde trae mercadería de calidad obteniendo un margen de ganancia importante.
texts.en:
Ligia is 43 years old and lives with her two children and her husband in the city of Grecia, in the Central Valley; she also takes care of a granddaughter. An entrepreneurial woman, Ligia worked in North America to support her daughter's education; her daughter now has a law degree. She earned capital to build her workshop, as she has always worked as a seamstress. She has partnered with a woman for whom she makes athletic wear to be distributed to various gyms in the area. In addition, she brings merchandise from the United States that she sells locally and in neighboring communities. She is independent and hardworking.

With her savings, she purchased machinery and improved the conditions of her workshop. She is requesting this loan to buy men's, women's, and children's clothing for the holiday season, and to buy high-quality raw materials to resume sewing athletic wear starting in the month of January 2014. Her  commercial activity includes significant assets: she runs two businesses that generate a steady income. In this season, she hopes to fulfill customer orders.

Ligia gets up early to take care of her house. At mid-morning, she works on cutting fabric to make garments in the afternoon. During the night, she does her billing and sales work. She hopes to give her son an education so that he can become a professional.

Ligia has machinery and equipment for her work, and a clientele to buy her garments. She has extensive experience in sewing, as well as contacts in the United States who enable her to run her business of bringing in quality merchandise and selling it at a good profit.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and raw materials to make athletic wear.

loans.name: Ulanoi

texts.en:
Ulanoy was born in the year 1970. She is married and has four children who are still minors. Her husband is a migrant worker, in Russia. She has been busy with growing crops and animal husbandry. In addition, she is a teacher. She has a higher education. Ulanoy has worked for more than 21 years in school. She is one of the best teachers. Ulanoy has a lot of pupils and they are grateful for her.

Ulanoy wants to repair her house, but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni. She will use the loan to buy building materials, such as cement and wood, for repairing the house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement and wood, for repairing her house.

loans.name: Shadrake

texts.en:
Shadrake is 30 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have three children. He would like to use a loan from Kiva to buy fertilizer for his maize crop to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that he can buy machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for maize farming.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu and she looks forward to supporting her family with the profits from her business. She is requesting a loan of Kshs 50,000 to buy soft drinks, soaps, salt, sugar and other food for sale.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, soaps, salt, sugar and other food for sale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is an experienced agronomist from Lusarat village of the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, three sons (20,18, and 5 years old) and her 12-year-old daughter. 

Mariam's husband works in the private sector, and is the main breadwinner of the family. His salary, however, is not enough to meet the needs of the family. 

Mariam and her family have been in agribusiness for more than 20 years. They are involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture, and in cultivation of alfalfa, peaches, and apricots.  With the help of the older sons, Mariam and her husband sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of their income. 

To be able to meet the growing needs of her family Mariam wants to enlarge her agribusiness a little bit. She needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase a cow and to buy some forage for cattle.

As this is Mariam’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. 

Mariam and her large family will be very thankful to the lenders for the goodwill and support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and to buy some forage for cattle

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela de 33 años de edad es una mujer agricultora y ama de casa, casada y madre de 3 siendo los 2 mayores independientes y solo el menor de 6 años depende de ella. Tiene un grado de educación primaria completo gracias al apoyo financiero y moral de sus padres a quien ella agradece mucho pero no pudo seguir estudiando por la falta de recursos ya que desciende de una familia humildemente económica. Desde hace 8 años trabaja en esta actividad en compañía de su pareja y agradece mucho a DIOS por los diferentes clientes que ha puesto en su trayectoria como agricultora ya que gracias a ello,  ella pudo construir su humilde hogar en el cual hacen pequeñas reuniones familiares para la elaboración de nacatamales y venta de comida entre otros que ayudan a generar mayores ingresos. El terreno fue adquirido por medio de una compra. Como desventaja en este rubro son las diferentes enfermedades y bichos que afectan los cultivos los cuales al no dar asistencia quedan expuestas y pueden ser perjudicados.
Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos agrícolas y semilla de papa certificada misma que será sembrada y cultivada ya que de esa manera ella podrá extender sus cultivos y generar mayores ganancias. 
Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y sean personas profesionales en la vida que tengan mejores oportunidades y mayores formas de generar sus ingresos para el sustento de sus familias ya que la mejor herencia que a un hijo se le puede dar es la educación, principios y valores.
texts.en:
Manuela, age 33, is a female farmer and housewife.  She is married and the mother of three children.  Her two older children are independent and only her six-year-old child is dependent on her.  Manuela completed her elementary school education thanks to the financial and moral support of her parents.  She is very appreciative, but she was not able to continue her studies due to a lack of financial resources and growing up in a modest family.  

For the past eight years, Manuela and her partner have worked together in their business.  She is very grateful to God for the different customers she has encountered during her time as a farmer.  As a result, she was able to build a modest house where she can have small family get-togethers and also a place to prepare tamales and sell food as a way of generating more income.  Her land was acquired through a purchase.  

A disadvantage of this line of work is having to deal with different diseases and pests that affect crops, so she must do whatever she can to prevent exposing her crops and sustaining damage.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative in order to buy farming supplies and certified seed potatoes that she can plant and cultivate.  This will enable her to extend her crop and generate more income.  

Her dream is to see her children study so that they can become professionals, which will provide them with better opportunities in life and the ability to generate more income to support their families.  The best inheritance that she can leave to her child consists of education, principles, and values.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and certified seed potatoes.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamín, es casado, tiene un hijo, vive junto a su familia, es empleado desempeñando la actividad de fontanería, ya tiene 8 años en este empleo, es de esta forma que cubre los gatos familiares.
Solicita capital para invertir en compra de herramientas como variedad de llaves, tubos, pegamento, entre otros, con lo que dará un mejor pervivió, espera realizar los trabajos encomendados en menor tiempo y también en su tiempo libre poder dar su servicio de manera independiente para tener ingresos extras y mejorar su economía.
Aspira seguir dando un buen servicio a su empleador así como a sus clientes, para tener los ingresos que le ayuden a cancelar sus deudas y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en: Benjamín is married, has a son, and lives with his family. He has been employed as a plumber for eight years, and this is how he pays the household expenses. He has applied for a loan to buy tools such as wrenches, pipes, and adhesive to do his work well. He expects to be able to do his work in less time and have free time to do freelance plumbing to earn extra income and improve his financial situation. He strives to do a good job for his employer and his customers so that he will have enough income to pay his loans and raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Mayram

texts.en: Mayram sews wonderful national Tajik women's dresses. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a kind man who tries to help her with all business deals. They want to provide their children with modern conveniences. The fast development of the modern world makes her children more progressive. Mayram tries to provide them with a better quality of life, which is why, 18 years ago, she began her business of sewing national women's dresses. Thanks to good service, she has managed to gain many customers. She would like to organize a birthday party for her child, but she cannot afford it. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni to organize a birthday party for her child. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to organize a birthday party for her child.

loans.name: Biby

texts.en: Biby is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1961. She lives with her three children in the southern Tajikistan. She is a widow; her husband died when her children were little. She raised her children with many difficulties. She works in a restaurant as a cleaning woman, working 7 hours, 7 days a week. She performs her duties perfectly. She needs to organize a wedding for her daughter who is getting married. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to organize a marriage party for her daughter. This loan will help to begin a new family in Tajikistan.

loans.use: To organize a marriage party for her daughter.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima was born in 1973; she is married and has five children. Fotima is careful mother. 

She has been busy sewing national women dresses for more than six years. Fotima is the main income earner of her family; her husband is a rental worker. Fotima works hard and tries to attract more customers to earn a living.

Fotima must organize her daughter’s marriage party, but she doesn't have the money. 

She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to make her daughter’s marriage party. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To make her daughter’s marriage party

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora was born in 1975. She is a married parent of three children. Gulnora lives with her family in a little village, near the mountains. She has been busy with growing agricultural products for more than 15 years. Gulnora grows wheat and potatoes. She grows potatoes and wheat on her own land. She began her business with selling milk. Gulnora, little by little, developed her business. Now, she manages her business well. She wants to sow but has no money. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola is 29 years old. She is married and has three children. Lola lives in the North part of Tajikistan, in a village. She has been busy with growing crops. 

She has additional income from animal husbandry. Lola feeds young cattle. She sells her crops and cattle in a local market. Her husband helps her with managing the business. 

Lola is going to sow crops but she has no money for it. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Jenilen

texts.en:
Jenilen is a 35-year-old woman from the town of Cortes, Bohol. She is married with four children, aged 14, 12, 6, and 5 months old respectively. Her husband worked as a laborer to support their family.

She engages in the nipa (native palm) weaving business. Nipa (native palm) is used widely by most Filipino typical houses. Aside from nipa weaving, she sells home made meals to customers in the community, to have an additional source of income. Her weaving business started a quite years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy bamboo slats (for nipa weaving), spices, and meat. This is very helpful in augmenting her income.

 In the future, Jenilen hopes to expand her both business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy bamboo slats (for nipa weaving), spices, and meat

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is a  married woman and a mother of five children from San Miguel, Bohol. She earns a living through her retail business selling clothing materials and cosmetics to the people in her area. She has been in the business for several years now. 

Demetria is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like clothing, cosmetics, and other items. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more products to her customers. Demetria hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like clothing, cosmetics, and other items

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is a fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man, and has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income. 

He is asking for a loan to buy gasoline and fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks for his business. With this, Rogelio will be able to improve his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Rogelio hopes of making his business a success, and saving money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks for his business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married and has five children. She operates a sari-sari or variety store selling various items to the people in her neighborhood in Bien Unido, Bohol. 

Lorna is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more stock of canned goods, candies, soda, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, and cooking ingredients. 

Through this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of canned goods, candies, soda, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol and has been in this business for more than eight years now. He is married. This is the source of his income. As of now, Joel is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm, thus, augmenting his yield and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Pompia

texts.en:
Pompia earns a living by operating a sari-sari (variety store), selling various goods to the people in her area, in San Miguel, Bohol. Pompia is a married woman and a mother of four children. Pompia has been in the business for several years now. This is the source of her income. 

Pompia is asking for a loan o buy more stocks to sell at her store, like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries, eggs and cooking ingredients. With this loan, she will be able to improve her stocks, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell at her store, like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries, eggs and cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in farming for several years now. Aurelia helps her husband in tilling their field. 

As of this time, Aurelia needs additional capital for her farm. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of seven children.  Celestina is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus, augmenting her yield and income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman and the mother of two children.She lives in Bien Unido, Bohol.

Josephine has engaged in fishing business with her husband for several years now.  Josephine is asking for a loan n to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: n to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks

loans.name: Jordan

texts.en:
Jordan is a married man who is very hardworking and responsible. He lives in his own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For the past two years, he has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. His potential customers are town dwellers. He cites high cost of maintenance being his major challenge. 

With the KES 50,000, he wants to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle. He joined Yehu to access loans to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle.

loans.name: En's Group

texts.en: En is a villager from Siem Reap Province. She is fifty five years old, a widow, and a mother of seven children. To feed the family, she plants rice on two hectares of farmland. She has been doing this for ten years and she can earn about 11,600 KHR per day. In the past, she applied for a loan through VisionFund(Kiva’s partner), which she successfully paid back, and helped her family live a better life. Now, she and her group are applying for a 500,000 KHR loan. She is the group leader of two borrowers and this is the third cycle for her. As the group leader, she will use her loan to pay for reaping fees. She hopes to harvest on time and improve her family's standard of living through rice farming.

loans.use: To pay for reaping fees.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Tourt's Group

texts.en: Tourt, aged 48, is a resident from the Srey Snom district of the Siem reap province. Tourt is married with four children. To make a living, she raises piglets and farms two hectares of rice for her main income. She has been doing this for ten years, and makes an income around 16,000 KHR per day. She is a past client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and it improved her family’s situation properly.  Now, she is applying for the third loan of 700,000 KHR.  As the leader, Tourt is going to pay for reaping fees. She expects to harvest on time.

loans.use: To pay for reaping fees.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sena's Group

texts.en:
Sena is a borrower from the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, 44 years old, and a mother of five children. 

The main source of her family’s income is rice farming. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her rice provided her with income of 22,200 KHR per day to support her family properly. She is a past client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has successfully paid back.  This helped her improve her family’s situation. 

This is the fifth time for Sena with VisionFund, and she leads a group of three. They are applying for 1,400,000 KHR for each.  

As the group leader, she will use her loan to pay for labor fees. 

She hopes her farming will grow on time and will gain good income for her.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Khem's Group

texts.en:
The mother of one son and a resident from the Moung Russey district in Battambang province, Khem is 25 years old and a farmer who plants rice for the main resource of income.  She works as a paid worker for additional income. She has been doing this for six years, and it earns her about 28,300 KHR per day. 

She is a past client with VisionFund; with the past loan, she was able to improve her family’s situation. 

Presently, Khem leads a group of three borrowers. This is the second cycle for her and her group member; they are applying for a new loan with VisionFund for 1,000,000 KHR for each. 

As the group leader, she is going to use her entire portion of the loan to pay for reaping fees. 

She hopes to better improve her family’s conditions.

loans.use: To pay for reaping fees.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: As a way of raising income to look after his siblings, Alex dropped out of school and started grazing people's cows for a wage. He then bought a few goats that he raised for some period and then sold them to buy a cow after saving hard.  He then acquired a loan to buy more cows to increase his stock and production and therefore, grow his income.  Alex is determined and hopes to build a permanent house for his siblings and to take them to school. He will buy cows to sell using the loan that will be granted to him.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen is a 38-year-old married woman; she has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals, such as baby goats, at low prices, brings them up and sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation.  Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase two more baby goats. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Vaja

texts.en:
Vaja is 66 years old, from the village of Javakhi in the Dmanisi district. He lives with his wife, and both are involved in agricultural activities. They have a cow, three pigs, and a plot of agricultural land, where they cultivate maize. He realizes income from selling the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. 

Vaja also has a small national bread bakery and wants to expand this activity. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 4,000 GEL for purchasing a vehicle. He will start distribution of his wife's baked bread and increase productivity. With the increased income, he will improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start bread distribtion

loans.name: Ligia Raquel

texts.es: Es una mujer cordial y emprendedora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 31 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos. Hace dos años estableció su negocio de venta de ropa usada con las remesas que le enviaba su compañero para la manutención de sus hijos, pero cada mes le reducía la cantidad, por lo que decidió iniciar su negocio con una paca de ropa usada, poco a poco fue incrementando su mercadería  con las ganancias percibidas. Actualmente cuenta con su propio local en el mercado de San Jerónimo. Solicita financiamiento para comprar 2 pacas de primera en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles. Su sueño es llegar a tener su local construido de concreto y cerámica, disponer de exhibidores con tubos galvanizados, ya que actualmente la ropa la tiene en mesas y rines, lo que no le permite exhibir bien.
texts.en:
Ligia Raquel is a cordial and entrepreneurial woman from Puerto Cabezas. She is 31 years old and the single mother of two children. Two years ago she started her business selling used clothing with the money her partner sent her to maintain their children; each month he reduced the amount, so she decided to start her business with a bale of used clothing. Little by little she increased her merchandise with her earnings. She currently has her own space in the San Jerónimo market. 

She is asking for financing to buy two bales of clothing in Managua and to sell it at accessible prices. Her dream is to get to the point where she has a store constructed from concrete and ceramic, and to have displays with galvanized tubes. Currently she has the clothing on tables and rims, which doesn't allow her to exhibit it well.

loans.use: to buy two bales of clothing in Managua and sell it at accessible prices

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a 35-year-old beauty salon proprietor in Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of two children whose spouse gives support. She has been in this business for the last five years and has done great.

This marks her fifth borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business.She will use the loan to purchase beauty soaps, ladies' hair weaves, and hair oil, and will use the anticipated profit to expand her salon business. 

In future she hopes to have a prosperous business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase beauty soaps, ladies' hair weaves, and hair oil.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru: Хусейн порядочный человек. Ему 50 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Он живет вместе со своей семьей на северной части Таджикистана. Хусейн 7 лет назад начал свой бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания. На сегодняшний день он продает индустриальные товары, как ведро, корыто, швабра и т.п. Он торгует в магазине. Его магазин находится в центре города. Хусейн сам справляется с бизнесом. Он регулярно обновляет свой товар и таким образом привлекает больше клиентов. Хусейн хочет пополнить свой оборотный капитал и с такой целью он обратился за займом. Хусейн запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для покупки индустриальных товаров для расширения оборотного капитала. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Huseyn is a 50-year-old man who is decent and married with four children. He lives with his family in the northern part of Tadjikistan. 

Seven years ago, Huseyn started a business buying and selling food products. Now he sells household goods like pails, washtubs, mops, etc. in his store which he runs himself. The store is in the center of town. He regularly refreshes his inventory and thus attracts a lot of customers. 

Huseyn is looking to increase his working capital, and is thus requesting a loan of US$1,500 to purchase household goods. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy home goods for resale.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to purchase nails, paint, timber and workshop tools for her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase nails, paint, timber and workshop tools for her business.

loans.name: Clara Yudy

texts.es:
Clara es madre soltera que se ha ganado la vida a pulso, trabajando arduamente para sacar a su hijo adelante. Actualmente se encuentra desempleada pero, con el ánimo de mejorar su situación económica decidió tomar en arrendamiento un local con todos los activos necesarios para montar su propia tienda de abarrotes; el oficio lo aprendió mientras vivió con sus abuelos, quienes eran propietarios de un negocio similar.
Solicita el apoyo del crédito con el ánimo de comprar surtido al por mayor (granos, galletería, café, chocolate, productos de aseo, lácteos, carnes frías, gaseosas, entre otros), así podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar buenos resultados para velar por el bienestar y el sustento de su hijo.
Esto le permitirá a Clara avanzar para cumplir el sueño de acreditar y fortalecer su negocio y que se convierta en su principal fuente de ingresos para garantizar a su hijo el acceso a una buena educación y brindarle mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Clara is a single mom, who has earned her life working hard in order to raise her son well. Currently she is unemployed, but since she wants to improve her economic situation, she decided to rent a place with all the necessary assets to start her own general store. She learned this business while living with her grandparents, who owned a similar business.
She is asking for a loan to support her in buying stock at wholesale prices (grains, cookies, coffee, chocolate, cleaning products, dairy products, cold meats, sodas, among others), so she can start her productive project with which she hopes to produce good results for the welfare and living expenses of her son. This will allow Clara to fulfill her dream of strengthening her business so it becomes her main source of income to guarantee her son's access to a good education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy stock at wholesale prices (grains, cookies, coffee, chocolate, cleaning products, dairy products, cold meats, sodas, among others)

loans.name: Magamed

texts.en: Magamed is a 42-year-old man from the village of Karajalari. He lives with his wife and two little children. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land where they grow greens, but they earn insignificant income from selling them. It's hardly enough to pay all family costs and satisfy the needs of a four-member family.  Magamed is motivated to improve the living conditions of his family and increase agricultural activity. He requested a loan 3,000 GEL to purchase chickens and, after raising them, start selling their eggs. He received the credit through a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, a start-up program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start a business. Magamed and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support.

loans.use: To set up a poultry farm.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 22-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and father in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. George gets orders and repairs houses. This is the only source of income for his family. As the income is not stable or enough to cover everyday costs, George decided to start his own business and requested a loan. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $3000 to start a business. With the received credit, he will purchase the raw materials to prepare Doner to sell. He has a commercial party, where he will start his Doner-making business. 

Doner is very popular fast-food, and George hopes that his business will be profitable and he will be able to generate a stable income. George awaits your support.

loans.use: to start up Doner (very popular fast-food) selling.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last four years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory, and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

She is a mother of two children, and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of rice, flour, and sugar from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demands consistently.

She is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 29-year-old married woman. She has been dealing in the business of selling fabrics in her community for many years. She buys different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Rubina is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Rubina expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem, age 46, is a married woman. She has been successfully running a business making and selling bakery items, such as rusks, bread and biscuits, with the support of her son and husband. 

They have been doing this for many years and earn a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Naseem has become famous for providing a good-taste bakery. 

Currently, she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase stock of ingredients like flour, sugar, and salt, along with packs of oil.  

Naseem is hopeful that she will able to generate more income though her larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase stock of ingredients like flour, sugar and salt, along with packs of oil.

loans.name: Tamah

texts.en: Tamah lives in New Kru town and is 32-years-old, married with two children ages three and five, both of whom are in school and live at home. For the past four years, she has been selling cold water, soft drinks, stout and beer. She started this business by selling rice around in the communities with the little goods she could afford, and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cold water, soft drinks, stout and beer for her business.  Her plan is to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cold water, soft drinks, stout and beer for her business

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en: Dorris lives in New Kru town. She is 50 years old and unmarried. Her fiancée is a contractor and they have five children. Four of the children are in school and live at home. For the past four years, she has been selling charcoal. She started this business with a loan from her friend and learned how to sell from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to build a bigger warehouse.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Shikha

texts.en:
Shikha is a 23-year-old lady of Petkathi village in Maynaguri. She has married Shyamal, a businessman. They have two children; one goes to school, and the other is too small to admit in a school. Shikha and her husband completed their education up to class VI (grade 6) and class IV (grade 4) respectively.

Shikha spends her most of the time doing household work, and her husband is associated with wood work. He sells firewood to people who use firewood for cooking. 

They need some capital to buy more firewood, as their customers are increasing day by day. Shikha applied for a loan of INR 15,000 from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy more stock of firewood. Nowadays there is a great demand for firewood in rural areas, as the price of LPG gas is going high, and the majority of rural houses use firewood for their cooking. 

Shikha thanks BJS and Kiva for giving this financial support.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for selling in the market.

loans.name: Faiqa

texts.en:
Faiqa is a 23-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing this for many years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en: Maqsood, age 54, has been successfully running a business selling milk to the people of her community for many years. Over time, she has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Her husband is employed in a mill but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. She is requesting a loan of PKR 40,000 through the Kashf Foundation to purchase a cow. It will help her increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is 30-years-old and a married woman and mother of four children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Azra has applied for a loan of Rs 40,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transportation service to his passengers. Azra is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to help her husband buy new tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 51-year-old married woman. She is been in the business of running a beauty parlor for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Through her providing the best services, she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetics products for the parlor.  But because of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for her loan of PKR 40,000 to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. 

She hopes to cater to more customers time after time and to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Fardoos

texts.en: Fardoos is a 41-year-old, vigorous lady and the mother of six children. She has been running a business selling cloths for the last ten years to contribute to the family income. Fardoos buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Fardoos is requesting a loan of Rs. 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Fardoos expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is 41-year-old lady who enjoys doing the work of hand embroidery. She started doing work with her daughters. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory, and she earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

She has two children; her husband is a driver by profession, but his income is insufficient to meet their household expenses alone. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes, and education.  

In order to meet the growing demand for embroidery, she needs to buy more frames, needles, and thread in different colors. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 45,000.  It will help in generating more income. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle and hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles, and thread in different colors.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, age 45, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.  She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. 

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another calf. 

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been a member of VEP for the last three years. She belongs to one of the groups called Mutuma from central Kenya.  As a member, she was among the first women to benefit from a credit to buy a solar package and jikos for her home. The solar package enables her to charge mobile phones and to use a small radio as well as to save on buying kerosene. The jikos (economical cooking stoves) save at least 50 percent of the firewood and the charcoal consumption compared to what she was using before, therefore easing the burden of buying charcoal and collecting firewood daily. The cook stove also reduces smoke emissions, making it better for her health.
Seeing an opportunity, Elizabeth decided to be an entrepreneur by being a distributor for solars and jikos. She approached VEP for financing and received a credit facility that enabled her to purchase small solar systems and jikos to sell to other women in women groups. As she was repaying the loan she also invested some of the profits to grow her business. After clearing the first loan she has approached VEP again for a second loan to boost the stock and she hopes to reap even more profits by targeting larger groups for more sales.
With this credit Elizabeth will be financially stable enough to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase solars and jikos (cooking stoves) for sale

loans.name: Milagro De Guadalupe

texts.es:
Milagro, es una mujer que a pesar de ser una madre soltera no se ha dejado vencer por la adversidad y ha sacado adelante a sus tres hijos, para cubrir los gastos familiares ella se dedica a vender variedad de antojitos y tamales lo hace de lunes a sábado, hasta la fecha no ha tenido ninguna dificultad en su negocio.
El préstamo le servirá para invertir en la compra de  harina, maíz, verduras, carnes, aceite, etc., que son parte de su materia prima para elaborar los antojitos y tamales. Espera aumentar producción, mejorar su calidad, mejorar las ventas, y mejorar su economía para cancelar las deudas y mejorar las condiciones familiares.
Sueña con mejorar la rentabilidad de su negocio y así contar con los recursos económicos para dar a sus hijos una oportunidad de superación educativa.
texts.en:
Despite being a single mother, Milagro is a woman who has not let herself be defeated by adversity and has taken good care of her three children. To cover the household expenses, she works selling a variety of popular snacks and tamales. She does this work from Monday to Saturday. So far, she has had no trouble running this business.

This loan will enable her to invest in the purchase of flour, corn, vegetables, meats, oil, etc., which are some of the raw materials required to make her snacks and tamales. She hopes to increase production, improve quality, sell more, and improve her budget in order to pay off debts and improve her family's living conditions.

Milagro dreams of improving her the profitability of her business in order to have the economic resources to give her children the opportunity to better themselves through education.

loans.use: to purchase flour, corn, vegetables, meats, oil, etc.

loans.name: Vidalia

texts.es: Vidalia es una señora de 41 años de edad, casada y madre de cinco hijos. Originaria de la ciudad Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de tortillería y pan casero. Inicio este negocio hace pocos años, con los ingresos obtenidos de su trabajo anterior. Viajo a Costa Rica, con el fin de trabajar, regresa a Nicaragua con el objetivo de tener su propio negocio. Actualmente tiene un pequeño negocio prospero, el cual le ha generado ingresos para su hogar. Su meta próxima es dar a conocer sus productos en los barrios de la ciudad. Solicita el crédito para comprar: azúcar, harina, manteca, huevos, polvo para hornear, entre otros, con el fin de cumplir con la demanda de su clientela. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá cubrir con los pedidos de sus clientes, y obtener un negocio creciente. Su plan futuro es tener su panadería.
texts.en:
Vidalia, 41, is married and has five children. She was born in Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí. She owns a tortilla and bread shop, which she started a few years ago with savings from previous work. She went to Costa Rica to work and came back to Nicaragua to start her own business. Her small business is profitable and generates income for her household. Her next goal is to make her products known in city neighborhoods.

She has applied for a loan to buy sugar, flour, shortening, eggs, baking powder, and more to meet customer demand. She believes the loan will help her fill customer orders and grow her business. She plans to one day have a bakery.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, shortening, eggs, baking powder, and more.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es:
Mario de 42 años de edad, casado con un hijo de 16 años, es originario de la zona central del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Desde muy joven ha tenido que luchar para salir adelante. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de postres y manjares, el negocio lo desempeña de forma ambulante. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, todos los días recorre las calles ofreciendo a sus clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de materia prima para los postres como leche, pan, canela, rin, servilletas, azucar, vasos descartables.  Mario agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mario, 42, is married and has a 16-year-old son. He was born in central Nicaragua, works hard, is responsible, and wants to succeed. He unfortunately didn't have money to study for a career. With effort and the desire to get ahead, he sells desserts and appetizers as a street vendor. He has had this business for 10 years, and he goes through the neighborhood every day selling to regular and new customers.

He will use this loan to buy supplies such as milk, bread, cinnamon, sugar, plastic cups, and napkins. Mario thanks the Kiva lenders for supporting low-income people in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have decent work.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as milk, bread, cinnamon, sugar to make desserts and appetizers and to buy plastic cups and napkins.

loans.name: Mgandi

texts.en:
Mgandi is a 50-year-old local chicken trader in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married father of four children, and his spouse earns additional income for the family. He has been in his business for the last 21 years and has done great.

This marks Mgandi’s fifth loan from Vision fund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the money to purchase more local poultry for his poultry business. He hopes to rear various local chicken breeds to feed the market around him and become a known local poultry trader in his community.

loans.use: To buy additional local chicken for his poultry business.

loans.name: Nyamawi

texts.en:
Nyamawi is a 38 years old mechanic whose garage repairs motor vehicles and motorcycles. He is a married father of six children. He has been in this business for the last twenty years and has done well.

This marks his fifth borrowing from Vision Fund, Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase spare parts for motor vehicles and motorcycles for his garage. 

The anticipated profit will be used to expand further as well as service his loan. He hopes to have a modern garage in future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motor vehicles and motorcycles.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Esther from Liberia. Precisely, she lives in New Kru town with her six children who are in school. She stopped her education in the ninth grade. 

Over the past ten years, she has been operating a table where she sells water and coal. She makes lots of profit. She started this business by selling for her mother, and learned this way of selling from her mother. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more water and coal for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more water and coal for her business.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling crockery for many years. She offers various types of crockery, such as glasses, dinner sets, and bowls. Her husband also assists her by selling the crockery to people in their community and in the local market. She earns a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. With this loan, she will be able to purchase a variety of crockery, such as tea sets, bowls, and glasses, in various sizes and designs. She is expecting to boost her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a strong credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of crockery, such as tea sets, bowls, and glasses, in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 57-year-old married woman running a business selling milk with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. They have five buffaloes and sell their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them, while her husband sells the milk to different places on a daily basis. They are happily working together to support their family. They also sell animals on a seasonal basis to generate extra income. They have three children and need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and education. In order to increase profits, Shamim requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo. They hope to increase the production capacity of milk, which will ultimately help generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Sahnaz

texts.en:
Sahnaz is a 39 year-old married woman who has  been doing business selling milk for the past 10 years. She has five calves and two cows in milk. 

She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She is a motivated mother, and provides her family with good education, food, and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. 

Now she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 25-year-old married woman; she has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase two more baby goats. 

She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is 44 years old, a married woman and the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is her husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional form. 

For this reason, Shameem has applied for a loan of Rs 50,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. 

This will help him drive more smoothly, and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Shameem is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Reiner

texts.en:
Reiner, age 36, earns an income by operating a small used-clothing shop. She has been engaged in her business for the past nine years. She and her husband have a 10-year-old child who attends school. The family lives in New Kru Town.

Reiner tells us that her friends taught her how to get started in this kind of business by selling door to door in her community, offering whatever small selection of clothing items she could afford. She now operates out of her own small shop.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more used clothes for her business.

Her goal is to continue to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchased used clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Manibala

texts.en:
Manibala is a 46-year-old woman of Maynaguri who is married to Gobinda. Both of them are illiterate, but can sign their names only. Her husband is a mason, and Manibala supplies materials, such as bricks, cement, stones, etc. for building construction, to the retail shops in the market. 

Manibala wants to develop her business to generate more income to maintain the family’s expenses, which are growing day by day.

Manibala requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more sand and stones to expand their business. She believes that through endurance and diligence, she can improve her business.

In the future, she wants to open a large builders’ shop in the local market with the profits of her business. She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding her.

loans.use: to purchase more sand and stones to expand her existing business of supplying building materials.

loans.name: Niorobala

texts.en:
Niorobala is a 47-year-old married woman, and her husband, Pulin, is 54 years old. Their only son is in class VI (grade 6). She has received education up to class IV (grade 4). They live in Khagrabari village of Maynaguri.

In childhood, Nirobala took the training of incense-making. Using that skill, she is preparing incense and supporting her family. Her husband is a mason. His income is not sufficient for the family. Sometimes he doesn’t have any work, especially in the rainy season. For the time being, he has to sit idle, and no income is generated by him at that time, so Nirobala wants to help her husband for a good livelihood. 

She is taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy raw materials like sticks, perfume, etc. for making incense on a large scale to sell in the market. She is trying to make her family’s financial condition better by contributing to her family the whole profit achieved from her own incense business.

Nirobala thanks BJS and Kiva for funding the loan.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials (sticks, perfume, etc.) for incense-making.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано прекрасная и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 51 года. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Рано живет одна и сама зарабатывает на жизнь. Рано более 5 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она производит дома «самбуса» и пельмени. Рано имеет своих клиентов. Ее клиенты из ее дома покупают ее пельмени и самбусы. Рано старается изготавливать свои продукции вкусно и качественно. Она считает, что только качественный  товар может привлечь много и постоянных клиентов. Рано живет в квартире, которое имеет плохое состояние. Рано планирует отремонтировать свою квартиру.
